Reviews.Title: “Olivia Plaza - Top location & Top staff”
Reviews.Author: LordOrk
Reviews.Content: Firstly, I am a wheel chair user and use a small 3 wheel electric scooter and contacted Elizabeth Jul VareaI at hotel reservations prior to booking and she was very helpful and assisted in making sure my requirements were satisfied on arrival and could not of been more helpful. Public areas are all accessible as is the entrance, no steps. Rooms have small showers and WC (if severely disabled you you need to take a pace in and out but is flat) but suites have a bathtub. I have stayed in Barcelona four times over last ten years and decided to try a more central hotel and the relatively new Olivia Plaza is an excellent contemporary modern hotel in the best location for exploring all Barcelona's top tourist attractions located on the Plaza Catalunya situated at the top of Ramblas. Transfer from the airport couldn't be easier as the accessible A2 airport bus with ramp picks you up outside terminal and drops you off on Plaza Cataluya which is few steps from hotel for 5 euros and takes about 25 minutes. Additionally since our last visit 5 years ago all the buses are accessible with ramps to take you to all the sights further afield such as Parc Guell for 2 euros, fraction of price of tourist bus. The hotel outside terrace is lovely to have a relaxing drink in the evening or enjoy dinner. The staff are all very friendly and helpful and enhanced our stay and made us feel most welcome and nothing was too much trouble. Recommend room on higher floor at rear with views over Barcelona towards sea or at front with views over Plaza. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: evamu
Reviews.Content: Hotel Olivia Plaza are highly recommended if you plan to go to Barcelona. The hotel is situated at Plaza Catalunya, the airport bus stop is here as well as the Hop on Hop off buses. La Rambla is just around the corner, close to shopping and restaurants. The rooms are modern and spacious, our room had panoramic windows overlooking Plaza Catalunya, free wireless internet, good cleaning and service minded staff. The toilet, however, offers no private moment as it is housed behind a glass door, unless you get a suite... Expensive breakfast, just over 20 euros per person, but there are several nearby cafes offering coffee and baguette for about 2-3 euros per person. After a few nights we were switched to a suite due to a mysterious problem with the lighting that they could not resolve. Every twenty minutes was lit all the lamps in the room for about 2 seconds, day or night! Overall, we are very pleased and we would not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and trendy”
Reviews.Author: Filippos K
Reviews.Content: Very cozy, modern style. The atrium for breakfast and lunch was quiet and the food delicious. The rooms renovated in a very modern style, with enough space. The view over Plaza Catalunia was another hit. Located in a central point, gives you the opportunity to look around every thing of tourist interest.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Lewis_England_9
Reviews.Content: Spot on location wise, at the top of the Ramblas, near the gothic quarter, right by the tour bus start points, the main shopping areas and near the tube. Staff were friendly and helpful. Bedrooms were comfortable and spacious. The only critisism we would have is thet the state of the art design for the bathroom is not practical, the toilet area was too small, with nowhere for the toilet paper, and the shower flooded the whole bathroom even with the door closed. We did not eat at the hotel as breakfast was a bit pricey, similar and cheaper to be had locally

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, spacious room, and professional service”
Reviews.Author: Elgalactico888
Reviews.Content: This excellent boutique hotel is in prime location on Placa Catalunya, which is the pivot point for all things happening i.e. turn left 15 metres and you are at the starting point for Las Ramblas. Tours and taxis are also plentiful and most of the taxi drivers knew the hotel and if they didn't, they do know Placa Catalunya. Staff were very professional and answered queries quickly, booked us on tours, and were very pleasant too...definitely do the Full Day All Barcelona Highlights Tour, which covered key Gaudi points, fast track entry into Sagrada Familia, and takes you to 'Spanish Town' at the end. Dined at the restaurant on the first day for a late lunch, and had roasted veg starter (which was excellent and I'm a carnivore), grilled squid which was brilliant too. Also dined at TA #1 restaurant Montiel which was amazing too (separate worthy review) Also visit the Bouqueria food market on the weekend....had tapas there but also a table behind us had their handbag stolen so do be cautious about pickpockets (older thief too I was told). I would recommend buying those discreet pouches that fit under your clothes well. Only downside was we heard typical door slamming, and curtains being opened/closed as they were electronic but that was minor. Overall, brilliant trip and would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Boutique Hotel..”
Reviews.Author: happy_to_travel_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Olivia Plaza for three nights to celebrate my husband and a friend's joint birthday. The hotel has an excellent location overlooking Place de Catalonia at the top of La Rambla and steps away from the airport bus stop. We were upgraded to a superior room(a lovely surprise) and the room was spacious, had lovely views of the square and, we thought, was beautifully decorated. The rooms are immaculately clean and the staff are really friendly and polite. We had breakfast on two of the three days we stayed which was okay .. not worth the price charged 22 euro(?) each. I would definitely recommend this hotel for convenience and style.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Base for Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: benceltic
Reviews.Content: Centrally located hotel situated right on Plaza Cataluna at the top of La Rambla. Friendly helpful staff, good rooms, restauarant and bar. Secure and quiet with underground parking. Free wi-fi and left luggage service.

Reviews.Title: “My bad luck!!!!”
Reviews.Author: rlwalex
Reviews.Content: I had a trip planned with a stay at the Olivia Plaza Hotel (Superior Room) in Barcelona Spain in September 2011. I had emergency surgery on August 28, 2011. I contacted the hotel to let them know what had happened and asked for a refund of my $600+ dollars. To date they not even responded to my request. I understand that this is a very nice hotel. It is sad they treat people the way they do! My bad luck!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for city trip”
Reviews.Author: Albert B
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! I was already on the check-out page of another hotel when I had doubts and ultimately switched to Hotel Olivia and I'm glad I did! The location is nothing short of perfect at the Placa Catalunya and just around the corner of the famous La Rambla. The rooms have a beautiful, contemporary design. Fantastic shower! My room had Plaza view which is great. Despite that it was nice an quiet at night. Bed was big and comfortable. I'm not sure how it would be with children but I'm sure other reviewers will cover that. The only thing I missed was a coffee/tea maker in the room and it was a tad short on closet space. I didn't use breakfast in the hotel. When I went down to get coffee it looked good but I'm not sure it's worth the E17.50 price. The staff is friendly, courteous and helpful and speaks English well. On the whole my stay here was a very pleasant experience. I would book again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: kit_kat008
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights at the beginning of March. The location is perfect if you want to be in the centre of the city, you are steps away from the Ramblas. We stayed in a standard room, facing away from the Plaza (be sure to request a Plaza facing room if you want one). The view even from the back of the hotel was lovely. The bed was very comfortable, and the room had all the amenities you would expect. One minor point is that the carpet was a little strange, made of a material that clearly showed mrks of bags being wheeled across it - I would question how they keep it clean. There is also very little storage space in the rooms, if you were to stay at the hotel for more than 2-3 nights, you would struggle with hanging and storage space for clothing. We did not try the restaurant/bar, although they looked lovely. The wifi is free and worked reasonably well. The staff were polite, and helpful when we had any queries. The hotel is on the expensive side, but you are paying for the central location. I would consider going back on another visit to the city.

Reviews.Title: “very good location and service”
Reviews.Author: Paulip
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Barcelona 8 nights and 3 nights in this hotel. Every staffs here is so nice and helpful, no exception. Especially Marco, Sandra and Marc are perfect. Location is very convenient and breakfast is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience! Highly recommend for business and pleasure.”
Reviews.Author: Leandra C
Reviews.Content: I recently planned a business visit to Barcelona for about 22 people. We needed a hotel that would work with a group, had English-speaking staff, was close to public transportation, and in the proximity of good restaurants for dinner. We found all that and much more at Olivia Plaza. Olalla, the Events Manager, and her colleagues made the experience unforgettable. We enjoyed the modern and spacious rooms, but it was the friendly and accommodating staff that made our stay so enjoyable. Olalla, in particular, went above and beyond to accommodate all of our needs and to handle every detail in the most friendly and professional manner. I plan visits like this in different countries every year. This was the best hotel experience we have had on any of our visits. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Amanda F
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about our trip to Barcelona including the hotel. Olivia Plaza is a reasonably price boutique hotel, with an excellent location. Our room was funky, large, had a great view over old buildings, and a really big comfortable bed. There is a courtyard at the back which is perfcet for a glass of wine in the evening. The staff were friendly and helpful. It whole experience exceeded expertations.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice staff but just okay for family”
Reviews.Author: D.M D
Reviews.Content: The rooms were as advertised. The staff was helpful. The location was great and the tourist bureau was across the street. Unfortunately, I travelled with a very large person and child who does not llike light when sleeping. The room divider in the Superior room was glass so when the lights were on so were they. The view from our window was lovely. I recommend the Olivia for couples, friends, or families with older children. The wifi is free but very slow if you are on a high floor. The students in the next room often did their homework in the hall for better reception. I would go to the Internet floor because the chairs were comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique hotel in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: globerunnerTO
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. My room was very large, and very quiet. Not an easy thing to get right in Plaza Catalunya. The location is perfect to drop your bags during the day and to get anywhere on foot is quite easy and safe. They offer free Internet which is a bonus those days, and my rate with breakfast was reasonable for this city. The room was spotless with comfortable crisp linens and a wonderful design element. Mostly it was the location that I loved best. The staff were very pleasant and helped to recommend very good restaurants and shopping areas which I had not been to. All in all I loved this place and would stay here again and again. Food at the hotel is also quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Pricy but good hotel in very central spot”
Reviews.Author: RotterdamHans
Reviews.Content: The key strong point of the Olivia Plaza hotel is its very central location, on Placa Catalunya right across from the airport buses, around the corner of the Ramblas - what more do you want. The hotel itself is good, rooms are spacious and clean and services are fine. The restaurant '19' is worth a try, especially sitting outside in the back yard facing the medieval city walls.A bit pricy - if you are looking for a good deal there are cheaper, good alternatives in the side streets.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay.”
Reviews.Author: CLG4127
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property for a 5 night stay and enjoyed it. As many people have written, the location was perfect, we did not have a car so it was nice having public transportation just outside the hotel door. The room was very clean and modern looking. The internet worked perfectly from our room. The bed was comfortable and had medium firmness. We had a park view and the street noise was minimal. The staff was very helpful with questions regarding our daily sightseeing. We did not eat at the restaurant. The only issue with our room is that it did have an alarm clock and the daily made service did not provide wash clothes. We would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Chiromanzi
Reviews.Content: By going online we got 4 days for the price of three, which turned out to be good value for money. This did not include breakfast, but I would recommend going out for breakfast, as eating breakfast in the hotel is very expensive. There are lots of good local places to eat. The hotel overlooks Catalunya Square, and is ideal for getting round the rest of Barcelona, either on foot, or using public transport - all forms of which pass through the square. Rooms are modern, well-designed comfortable and clean. Staff very friendly and helpful (although I didn't like the restaurant they recommended, and gave us a discount voucher for.) Free use of computers, and free wi-fi. Definitely will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Pampula
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect and the view from the windows facing to Plaza de Catalunya is stunning (the size of the windows is from floor to the ceiling). Also liked the layout of the decoration, it was nice that you could brush your teeth while seeing the city view. The size of our room, 809, was big enough. Rain shower a nice plus. Personnel in the reception very nice and helpful, got good restaurant recommendations from them. Airport bus stop 50m away, convenient. This was my sixth time in Barcelona, always stayed in different 3-4 star hotels and Olivia Plaza is definately the best one. Would stay there again. Odd smell in the room 809, like after shave bottle broken down in the floor or old smell of smoking? In the evenings WiFi didn´t work so well in the room. In the mornings it worked almost normally.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in BCN”
Reviews.Author: sassalicious
Reviews.Content: We were in BCN for 2 weeks for business. This was the perfect location to be in the city. Right at the main metro stop and right on Placa Catalunya at the intersection of several fabulous neighborhoods. Easy to get to work on the metro, then to shopping and restaurants in the evenings. I had a room facing the Placa, and I would have thought it would be noisy, but it was very quiet and the black-out blinds make it nice and dark for sleeping. The mattress was an American sized King (nice!) but was a little firm, still, pretty dang good for a European bed! Some people complained about the flooring being marked, up but I didn't mind it. It was clean. Customer service is not exactly the same in BCN as it is at home in the states, yet we were pleasantly surprised to find excellent customer service at the Olivia Plaza... from the front desk to the wait staff in the restaurant (remembering our favorite drinks :). Even the doorman was always friendly. Only complaint: the wifi is really weak in the rooms and there are no LAN connections for internet. Also, they don't use a WEP key you can enter once and have your device remember... it makes to route to a web page to log in EVERY time you want to access the wifi... total pain! So basically, I had to be in the lobby to access a connection. Since my smart phone only uses wifi while I'm out of my home country, this was a huge pain for me. Also, I didn't really want to be conducting work in the lobby. If this had been a better experience, I would have given the Olivia Plaza a rating of excellent. I suggest taking the AeroBus from the airport.. only 5,30 euro (at the time) each way and it stops about 200ft from the hotel entrance! Bus was clean and comfortable with plenty of room for luggage. No reservations needed. Jan-Feb is a great time to shop in BCN. Even though the euro is strong against the USD, there are lots of sales to enjoy this time of year. September is beautiful and not too touristy too!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect choice!”
Reviews.Author: Betty829
Reviews.Content: We are three sisters just back from a 4 day break in Barcelona. Having trolled through the internet we eventually came across a little gem in the city centre - the Olivia Plaza Hotel right on the Placa de Catalunya. This hotel is in an excellent location for sightseeing, shopping or just rambling around the city. The airport bus and also the bus tours are located nearby. If you would lke some retail therapy the large department store, El Cortes Ingles and Passeig de Gracia are close by with La Rambla just a stone's throw away. We cannot speak highly enough regarding the staff. We were warmly welcomed at reception by Rebecca and offered a complimentary bottle of cava as we were celebrating a birthday. We had two adjoining rooms on the 10th floor with a magnificient view of Placa de Catalunya. We were a little worried that it would be noisy at night but not a sound from the street was heard. The rooms are spacious and beautifully decorated with really comfortable beds. I think the hotel is suitable for all ages - whether it is a family, couple or a girls break away. All of the staff in this hotel are exceptional - so friendly, polite and helpful, We would particularly like to mention the ever smiling Rebecca at reception, Fernando who was so helpful and the good humoured Sergio who made our stay so pleasant. The staff are truly an excellent asset to this hotel. We would have no hesitation in recommending the Olivia Plaza while visiting Barcelona. We can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “A great find”
Reviews.Author: Voager21
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located - just off the Ramblas (even though other hotels say they are, this one really is!) and nearby all the shops, local attractions and opposite the bus garage so really well located. The staff were really friendly, and given we stayed in high season, still made us feel really special and important. The roof terrace outside is beautiful - were were allowed to bring our own alcohol - none of the "you have to buy from the hotel bar" nonsense. The rooms were very clean and comfortable - bathrooms spotless. We thought this was really good value for money given we could walk almost everywhere in no time at all!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: JBLuvTravel
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Olivia Plaza. Location is ideal and the rooms were fairly quiet. Very clean with lots of places to store your belongings made it easy to keep uncluttered. The restaurant was overpriced, but high quality. Service in the hotel and restaurant was excellent. Overall, very good value for the money and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: PoolLovinFoodies
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights with my husband, parents and sister over the Christmas holiday. Pros: -Top location for ease of seeing sights and accessing the metro -Tastefully decorated rooms -Stellar service, warm and friendly with making reservations and arranging logistics for seeing the sights. Even before arrival, very prompt and friendly responding to emailed questions Cons: -Biggest complaint was the inability to run A/C in our room. It was so warm at night and especially getting ready in the morning. We all left our rooms as soon as possible in the AM! The staff instructed us to just leave the heat off, but the residual heat from the hotel lobby etc still baked us in our room. -Shower would leak into the toilet room, causing a slight mildew smell Overall, you can't beat the location and friendly service! No issues with noise or safety. We did have drinks one night at the bar which was expensive (as most hotels are). Also had brunch one morning (decent but not excellent) which again we did with full understanding of premium price. One final tip, don't take a cab anywhere on 12/26! We had to leave early to catch a flight and the hotel told us about $25 for cab ride (bus wasn't running that early) - it ended up being $50 due to boxing day and we almost ran out of euro paying the driver!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely - but be aware of noisy neighbours”
Reviews.Author: Helen P
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect for sightseeing and shopping (if you are that way inclined). All the staff, without exception were professional, polite, friendly and helpful. But the hotel advertised sound proofed rooms. Ours was not - cue snoring man in the room next door who fell asleep with the telly on and then phone rings and rings and rings at past 1am - didn't make for a good night sleep!! The hotel website also said that they would provide bathrobes and slippers, but there weren't any in our room - we weren't fussed, so didn't complain. I have food allergies, so it wasn't worth us paying €20 per person for breakfast, so we ate breakfast out.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Lara8283
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated on Plaza Catalonia, so the location is perfect for sightseeing. You are in the middle of the city, touristic bus & buses from the airport stop on the plaza. Really 5-minutes walk from Gothic district and a minute walk to Rambles. The hotel is new. Very nice rooms with modern shower room. We stayed in superior room, it is a little bit bigger than a regular one (and it does not have sink in the room, superior room have a separate shower room & toilet), So if you have a chance to upgrade do so. Our room was on the 2nd floor, but we practically did not hear traffic noise. The view on the plaza is amazing, you have this great feeling that you are in the middle of life in Barcelona even when you are in your room. Breakfasts is very nice, with champagne:)). Staff is very helpful. We definitely recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location hotel”
Reviews.Author: Barbara B
Reviews.Content: Great hotel right in very centre of Barcelona. Very friendly, helpful staff who accommodated all our needs. Lovely eating area downstairs. Room and bathroom spotlessly clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great unbeatable location, helpful and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: KULTraveller
Reviews.Content: Unbeatable location, the rooms adequate and staff (especially Fernando and Rebecca) friendly and helpful. For the price not much to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend”
Reviews.Author: H0ckeyman
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend at the Olivia Plaza Hotel, my wife and I had a great time in Barcelona. The hotel was immaculate very clean and tidy and the staff were exceptionally helpful. The location could not be better for easy access to the Gothic quarter, easy transfer from the Airport by the Aerobus (almost right outside the hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: jodi a
Reviews.Content: We stayed here pre-cruise this summer. The hotel has a lovely garden where we ate our buffet breakfast and a nice little lobby. The rooms are modern and spacious and very clean! The hotel is centrally located in the heart of Las Ramblas which is why we chose it.

Reviews.Title: “Not for Us”
Reviews.Author: churchcottage
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed with our stay at this hotel. The rooms looked chic and sophisticated on their website but in reality they are cold looking and stark. The natural carpets were badly marked from the suitcase wheels of numerous other travellers and the lighting in the rooms is dreadful. Very poor selection of TV channels, I would have expected a hotel of this standard to have had some form of satellite reception. I would say in fairness that the staff are very friendly and the position in Barcelona is excellent. We had a room overlooking the square and had no noise at all from the street. But I am amazed at the outstanding reviews of this hotel, it was nothing special at all and we most certainly would not chose to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lucky to have found this hotel :)”
Reviews.Author: Lydelic
Reviews.Content: I arrived to Barcelona and I luckily went to Olivia Plaza in the afternoon with a last minute change of plans, nevertheless the staff at the reception was most understanding and helpful as I didn't have any prior booking. I was offered a really nice room which was comparatively less expensive than other similarly rated hotels in Barcelona. The service staff was very amiable, quick and professional; on the other hand the room was very clean and comfortable. The hotel is in the middle of the famous Plaza Catalunya, and is right next to La Rambla and the Gothic area which are a must see in Barcelona. I had a great stay in Olivia Plaza and would definitely recommend it to all ages!!

Reviews.Title: “B B plus”
Reviews.Author: MBadvisor
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I have visited. Great view of square. Good food. Modern furn. Friendly staff. And By walking around you will find more than 50 interesting things to do. Like food, tour bus, shopping malls, ancient culture, la Ramblas street, dealer, hard rock, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Best ever!!”
Reviews.Author: Sophie D
Reviews.Content: Olivia Plaza is the most perfect hotel you can imagine in the combination with the lovely staff, a very nice kitchen with both breakfast and proper food, perfect cleanliness, very nice and big rooms with everything you can possible need and the most perfect location. It cannot be better.I can imagine going back to Barcelona just because of the hotel!! Best Regards, Sophie Dahlgren Sweden

Reviews.Title: “Great for exploring Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: 10below
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay here for christmas with the family. Central location, modern justified 4 star hotel, friendly staff. Our room was large and comfortable with a great view and no issues with noise despite the very central location. Buffet breakfast was varied and good. Overall we thought very good value for money and would definetely consider staying here again on a next trip to wonderful Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: GLT14
Reviews.Content: Picked the hotel for 3 reasons - larger rooms than typical in Barcelona, free Wifi, and location. None disappointed. Airport bus stops right outside and metro is near, but hotel as other reviewers say is very quiet. Staff very pleasant, rooms immaculate, lots of storage space and wodnerfull showers. Room spacious, light and airy, (and onky a standard room, I think) good bed and terrific view over the Plaza. we stayed four days over Christmas and it was good value. Only ate in the restaurant once - breakfast was OK but obviously hotel prices and there are much better places down towards the old town. Our one dinner was good if unremarkable. Wifi signal weak in room (8th floor) but very good in public areas and computer area was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant boutique hotel with fantastic showers”
Reviews.Author: ewanmacleod
Reviews.Content: Don't expect huge rooms unless you're booking their suites. The standard rooms are small but fantastically designed to make good use of space. The best feature of this hotel is, without a doubt, the shower. They are monsoon style and simply wonderful. The bar downstairs is useful as it's open late, staffed by a friendly team and usually quiet in the evenings. The hotel location is ideal for checking out Barcelona -- it's right on Plaza Cataluna and about 100 paces from the top of Las Ramblas and the underground. The internet has always been a problem. Some rooms have excellent WiFi reception, others not. So be explicit with the team when you check-in if you're needing a decent connection.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Akyuruk
Reviews.Content: Located in the Plaza Catalunya, you can't stay a more central place in the city. Best for city dwellers. Good rooms, good breakfast and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great location”
Reviews.Author: aerotraveller
Reviews.Content: Olivia plaza is so well located, right on the Plaza Catalunya. The hotel is modern in style--the rooms are pristine and the beds are very comfortable. Internet worked well and was included in my rate. I agree with the other reviewers that it is quiet despite being situated in the middle of town. Breakfast is delicious and worth including in your reservation. Take the airport bus which is a great value and drops you off close by. I cannot stress what a terrific value this hotel represents--with friendly staff and attractive accommodations, you will leave with a smile on your face.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel to stay as a family :)”
Reviews.Author: msakia
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel between 13-18 Nov 2011 and I have to say it was a great choice :) We stayed in room 408 on the forth floor with a georgeous view ti Catalunya Plaza. I cant say a bad word about this hotel! The location is perfect, and hotel is very sound proof which makes it perfect to stay wit a toddler- feels like you are the only guest in this hotel :) Rooms were spotless, same with bathrooms and toilets. Bed was huge and the baby cot was provided, nice and colorful which our daughter loved. Staff, always ready to help, proviede everything we needed. Didnt use the hotel restaurant, so cant tell anything about the food, but it did look like they have a great variety. I am happy to answer any questions if anyone needs an advice :)

Reviews.Title: “GREAT”
Reviews.Author: brdany
Reviews.Content: great hotel ecellent location. in plaza catalonia middle of barcelona. the rambale is just outside to the left of the hotel. al the tourist attraction in near by walking. if you want a bus many bus line is passing in front of the hotel also metro sation. the AREO BUS that connect the city to the airport is 100 meter/ the city tour bus also next 50 meter were you can take the on/off tour bus. 2 lines blue and red. the front desk was very helpful about tourist information. we stay in room 408 face the plaza but no noise. nice wiew of the plaza big windows. the breakfast was good keep us most of rhe day. ill recommend it to my friends and if im back ill book there egain

Reviews.Title: “outstanding location”
Reviews.Author: brighiroma
Reviews.Content: i do recommand this hotel to everybody who wants to spend just a few days and live just in the very centre of Barcelona. from here you can reach all the most important sights by foot. the hotel is quiet new, modern and very nice furnished....it is clean, the service is good and although you are in the very centre, it is a very quiet hotel and you sleep very well.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: A D
Reviews.Content: This, newly renovated, lovely hotel is situated right on the Rambla, the heart of the city. It is clean, friendly staff, comfortable bed, has internet (and helpful staff if you get stuck using it.) I was there only one night, but would have gladly stayed longer. Price is reasonable, too. Delicious and varied breakfast. Yummy! Nice, elegant bathroom, all glass.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service and location!”
Reviews.Author: laaldeana
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night but the location is excellent right on Plaza Catalunya, the service is outstanding and the breakfast just perfect! This is a great place to stay. The price is well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “SIMPLY THE BEST LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: postcard13
Reviews.Content: Location of the Olivia Plaza could not be better for sightseeing Barcelona. Two night stay prior to joining a cruise ship, room very good, see photo, good shower plenty of pressure, very clean. As we arrived late the first evening we ate in the hotel, good choice, good service. Exceptional friendly reception staff. Pleasure to stay will glady return.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but far to expensive”
Reviews.Author: OTod
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location to experience the sentral parts of Barcelone. Airport bus and metrostation right outside. Very good breakfast if you are willing to pay four time the worth. We have stayed in rooms in top-floor. With a terrazze facing Placa Catalunya you really can enjoy a night-cap. With room at the other side of the hotel you have a magnificent view over the old town. But the price is far to high. For half the price you can have very, very good hotels nearby. And don't try to make requests by e-mail. They never will answer you anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location!”
Reviews.Author: FalWetVet
Reviews.Content: Close but not right on top of the noisey Las Ramblas, everything is right here. Safe contemporary hotel with an interesting, charming twist of the 16th Century church walls exposed and abutting the restaurant and courtyard. Terrace Rooms (only 4) are worth the price they overlook the square and with the table and chairs it is nice additional living/dining space. Only complaint, for which hotel has no control, is the collective group of Algerian women begging along the sidewalk (think SlumDog!). On the street watch your bags & pockets...gypies, tramps & thieves! Tour bus has 3 routes - we did a 2 day pass and it was well worth it - being able to hop on/off.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: WhiteVanDad
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a short break in the Olivia Plaza. The welcome at the reception was first class and the staff were pleasant and helpful with directions and recommendations. The gentleman who checked us in was able to call me by name the following day. A nice touch. Breakfast was great...a little pricey but worth it if you want to linger a while and get set up for the day. We did! I think for reviewers to grumble about price in that location is unfair - just try a street cafe on La Rambla and see what you are asked to pay for a glass of coke (5.5 Euro in one case)!!! We were upgraded to a superior grade room without asking and without charge. It was 5th floor with a view of the square. Extremely comfortable king size bed and no sleep problems. Great shower etc. Yes, the room lighting controls could be improved and the window coverings could be less than ideal on lower floors. Also, some English language tv channels (other than BBC news) would be welcome; but, in all a lovely stay in a superb location. A first class introduction to beautiful Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but 1st room had no bathroom door, 2nd room had no window”
Reviews.Author: GinaZ41
Reviews.Content: Nice enough hotel, terrrific location, but was not happy with the rooms we got. We booked a standard room, checked in at 2 pm, but the hotel was already nearly full, and we had to wait 10 minutes to check in due to line up. When we did check in, we got room 309, king bed, big window that faced the back - not the plaza (on the website is says "view or gothic neighbourhood" it was sort of the back alley). Room was very nice - but then we saw that the glass sliding door that slides between the shower and the toilet stall was not there. Must have been recently broken. So - there was no door on either the toilet stall or the shower, not sure why they even gave the room the OK to occupy. They gave un another room, but the room we got - 712 - did not have an exterior window, only a piece of glass facing the inside of the hotel. The website clearly says that standard rooms have views of the plaza or the "gothic neighbourhood". When I went back to ask to get a room with an exterior window, they were completely full and did not understand my issue. It's a pretty expensive hotel so I'm surprised that they even have rooms that do not have exterior windows. On our first night they did send up a free bottle of cava, which was nice - but for the money, I would not book there again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't hesitate to stay here”
Reviews.Author: LFD3
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Barcelona and stayed at the Olivia. It is a very qaint and quiet hotel right in the middle of all the action. I stayed there with a good friend, and the bathrooms were NOT a problem. The room and bathroom were clean and bigger than anticipated. There is 24 hour security at the front door, which was a nice feature.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of BCN but peaceful”
Reviews.Author: berksbs
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this lovely hotel for 4 nights and I have no complaints. I chose the Olivia because it is so convenient, all the tour buses, airport buses and metro stations are right outside and El Corte Ingles department store is only 100 metres away! Around the corner is Las Ramblas and all the hustle and bustle of this essential part of Barcelona. Inside the hotel it is very comfortable with an excellent breakfast and the lunch and dinner menu also looks good but with so much to choose nearby we did eat in other restaurants. We had rooms on the 2nd floor, which faced Placa Catalunya, which I would recommend as I think some rooms only have a window onto the interior courtyard. The rooms are very modern, the beds are huge, confortable, with fresh white sheets every day. There are unusual sliding doors to the shower cubicle and toilet and the wardrobe and shelves are open to the room (no doors) none of this was a problem for us and just made it more interesting. The hotel staff were always friendly and helpful and all in all the hotel really made our few days in BCN extra special.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AngieRoberson
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location of this hotel. It is right in Plaza Cataluna near Las Ramblas, restaurants, tourists buses, shopping, etc. I am a female and travelled alone. I felt safe the entire time. Rooms are well appointed, clean, modern and comfortable. Get a Plaza view if you can. The rooms have large floor to ceiling windows and it was wonderful to eat breakfast while watching the world outside.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Good service, Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: MariaNC987
Reviews.Content: Nothing bad to say about this hotel. While I had a leak in the room when i arrived they were prompt to move me to a different room and solved the situation very quickly. Breakfast is a bit expensive so considering the location you can just pop next door and have a nice breakfast in any cafe on the Ramblas. The room was very nice, the location was excellent, the pateo was gorgeous, the food and drinks were fabulous. Very happy to have stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “A welcoming hotel close to everything.”
Reviews.Author: ChiBones
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel because of its location. Did not take the breakfast because We planned on being up and out early. However we wound up being out late (Catalonians eat LATE!) and waking up at 9. Hotel staff is well trained, rooms are very modern and the location is fantastic. The metro and buses are right outside - we took the metro mostly but the bus is good too - traffic is not bad. You don't really need a tour - just wiki all the sights and you will have plenty of information. You can even take the metro to Montserrat. We loved Barcelona - my new favorite city - whole areas are pedestrian only, Gaudi is amazing, the city is sparkling clean (unlike Rome where I am now) the restaurants are full of energy and the Segreda Familia almost made me rethink my lapsed Catholic status. The hotel staff helped me with directions, called me when I set a wake up call and met every need. What more can you ask?

Reviews.Title: “Ultra Modern Right on the Park”
Reviews.Author: TravelMavenUS
Reviews.Content: Clean, ultra modern hotel facing the Plaza de Catalunya. The perfect central location to La Rambla Street; the street where everything happens in Barcelona. We reserved 2 rooms for our party. 3 in a suite and 2 in a balcony superior room. When we arrived we received an upgrade to another suite. As an ultra modern hotel, there is no swimming pool or fitness area. A little disappointing as we were with our family and wanted to swim at night. Many of the other hotels nearby and throughout the popular districts have rooftop pools. The most weird part of the room was the lighting and switches. The lighting was 99.9% halogen with one fluorescent table lamp. As with previous reviewer comments, the light switch either turned the halogens on full or off. Nothing in-between. Also, some rooms had a separate light switch but it was wired incorrectly and turned on other rooms. After playing with the switches a couple of times, they would get overheated and stop working. You would have to take out the central room key from the electrical slot and replace it to reset the switches. Since there were no night lights and it was completely dark at night, we used the fluorescent lamp in the bathroom as a night light. Housekeeping was very attentive and fast. We called to have the pull-out bed made up since it wasn't done when we returned after dinner. Literally within seconds there was a knock on the door. The only other recommendation is to either bring ear plugs if you want a direct view of the plaza. At night it is quite loud with activities going on after midnight. We were also there during a local holiday, so there were also fireworks going on as well. There is a motorized shade to block out the sun into the room. The button is on both sides of the bed. That was pretty cool. Take the double decker bus for a tour of Barcelona. It runs all day and night and you can pick it up from the plaza. There are 3 different bus lines all for the one price, and you can get on and off as many times as you want during the day. Well worth the price. We didn't eat at the restaurant, and read from previous posts that the breakfast was expensive. We ate on La Rambla which happened to be just as expensive. Look for restaurants that offer buffets for breakfast. It's much more affordable than ordering off the menu...It's pretty much ala-carte dining in European cities. Dining Tip: In Barcelona they charge for water (bottled only - no pitcher or free refills), coffee is per cup, and each piece of bread at the table. Even if they serve the bread, if you eat it, you pay. If you don't eat it, you don't pay. Very strange from U.S. customs. We were a table of 5, we each ate 2 pieces of bread and were charged 21 euros ($32.00 US) just for bread...the charge for water was another 12 euros...OUCH! And finally, don't take a taxi to and from the airport if you are staying at this hotel, or one on the plaza. There are special buses, that accommodate luggage, which run from the plaza to both terminals of the airport. You can't beat 6 eruos each way and it runs from 6:30am to late at night. Total trip time was 20 - 25 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Location isn't everything”
Reviews.Author: KT_in_Europe2011
Reviews.Content: If you like modern, clean, stylish hotels, you might be tempted to stay at this hotel. Don't. Anyone with a passion for chic hotels which are value for money will be disappointed by aspects of this hotel. The rooms are great - modern, very spacious and clean. But the location of the room is important. Ask for a high floor. Our room was on level 1 overlooking Plaza Catalunya and the double-glazed glass wasn't enough to keep Barcelona's busiest square outside. There is also a goldfish bowl factor (ie, people could see in at night unless you sacrificed your view and closed the blind completely). The staff were a tad icy and some pretty basic polite requests for items which formed part of our package were met with indifference. Breakfast really wasn't worth the money - although the atrium restaurant area is very picturesque. If location is your priority, then it doesn't get more central than this hotel, but overall, in a City of fabulous hotel choices, there are definitely better options for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: AlexandraMaria
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel on Plaza Catalunya. Modern and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel on the Plaza Catalunya”
Reviews.Author: MEMR50
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the Olivia based on a recommendation from a friend and thoroughly enjoyed it. Our room was on the 5th floor (room 501) overlooking the wonderful patio and a lovely old stone church, a great view. We had two twin beds, a small table with two chairs and a very modern bathroom with walk in shower and seperate toilet room. The patio was lovely with stone walls and trees. We opted not to have the breakfast, a bit pricey for us but it looked pleniful and varied. The front desk was very helpful with maps and tips on sight seeing, and the location was excellent. We caught a bus from the airport that dropped us off right by the hotel in the Plaza for 5E. Buses and the entrance to the subway are across the street with an information booth in the subway entrance. An excellent location to see all the sights of Barcellona.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Find!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah P
Reviews.Content: This gem is in the heart of the action! We had 2 rooms for 3 nights. The rooms were furnished just exactly like the pictures on the website. They were clean, efficient and a good size. There is a doorman on staff 24/7. I felt like the entire hotel staff was very friendly. This hotel is also in the perfect location. You can walk to most places, get on a hop on/hop off bus, take a city bus, or catch a taxi either at the hotel or right across the street. Free internet service is available 24 hours/day. Don't forget to try the hotel's restaurant. They have a cute outside patio. A relaxing way to end a day of sightseeing with a pitcher of sangria and good food!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: B500
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here last weekend. Very modern hotel. Clean, good service, very nice rainshower, great room, good selectio of breakfast. Location is also great, touristic hop on/off bus close to the hotel. Nice walk from the hotel to the harbour. Recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Taner3
Reviews.Content: Olivia Plaza is right at the center of the city, Plaza Catalunya. It is adjacent to an old church which makes it something special. Modern design, nice service. We took advantage of the "free breakfast" option provided by tripadvisor. The breakfast buffet was rich and satisfying. Level A is for free internet. Moreover, there are nice art magazines for those interested (I enjoyed them). We had supper one night in the Hotel's restaurant. The service was nice and the price was OK. Take the elevator to the 10th floor for a nice view of the city. The only negative issue was that I could not get a 110 V to 220 V adapter (flat to round jack) for 2 days and could not charge my camera battery.

Reviews.Title: “Best location”
Reviews.Author: snowbird1105
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Olivia Plaza hotel for three nights in July before our cruise. The hotel is very centrally located. We had a room overlooking the Catalunya Plaza which was very nice and comfortable. However, the floor was so old which made it look dirty. Oddly, the bathroom vanities didn't come with a soap. And the hotel's breakfast was very unreasonable priced. The free wi-fi works but slow sometimes.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: luxlove
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 4 days. Its on a very busy place, Plaza Catalunya, but not to worry, once you enter the hotel, its a oasis Of calm. Beautiful, and fancy rooms, especially the bathrooms. Very modern and clean. Ceiling to floor Windows overlooking the plaza was excellent! Good breakfast buffet, and very Nice staff, helping us book restaurants etc. We stayed with two kids, Room divided with colored glass- door. Excellent location-- walking distance to a lot, If not, buses and taxis right outside the door. Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: bgoodman8
Reviews.Content: Had an amazing time.Room was lovely. Suite 806. Location was amazing. Staff were so friendly, couldn't do enough for us.Even arranged a meal reservation at Hard Rock Cafe for my son's 8th birthday. Breakfast was excellent with a vast choice . A good start to the day. Loved it. Loved it. Loved it.!!!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'' definitly be back”
Reviews.Author: KevinEllul
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Olivia hotel for 2 nights. The room we were in was beautiful, as it had a panoramic view of Placa Catalunya. The hotel is in a very central location. Metro is just a few seconds away from the hotel, and it is surrounded by numerous shops and cafes. La Ramblas is just round the corner. Excellent Hotel and highly recommended. The breakfast is a little expensive, but cafeteria is just outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: YIANNOS M
Reviews.Content: We visited the hotel in the beginning of August. We used the Aerobus that takes you directly outside the hotel. We arrived at 12:00 at noon ant the Receptionist kindly asked as if we can wait until 15:00 to give as our room. It worth the delay since the room was great on the 10th floor with a great view. The only bad thing was that it was not 100% clean but still it was nice. The breakfast is also great and of good quality. The Wifi was good but not constant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Magnificent View”
Reviews.Author: LotusExplorerTravel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a couple doors away from the Hard Rock Cafe and faces Placa de Catalunya (City Center). The Aerobus from the airport drops you off just around the corner. The location was very convenient and a short walk to La Rambla and exploring the many interesting streets of the Barri Gotic. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast was delicious. The view of Placa de Catalunya from our balcony was definitely a highlight of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: MarkKwok
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very conveniently located at Plaza Catalunya and within walking distance to Las Ramblas, Museu Picasso, Barri Gotic and the high end Eixample district. The staff is very friendly and always greet me with a smile. I was given a room on the 7th floor overlooking Plaza Catalunya and so had a great view. The double room comes with a huge bed with comfortable bedding. There is a cafe immediately next to the hotel so it comes in handy for a quick charge of caffeine. The Carrefour Supermarket is about 10 minutes walk from the hotel. The layout of the bathroom is very open, and one needs to strip in the room before getting in the shower stall. No problem if travelling as a couple but may be inconvenient for a family or friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great room horrible internet.”
Reviews.Author: GuillermoSarah
Reviews.Content: The room is simple good for the price and what if offers is great the location amazing in the center of everything but the internet as for my expierence in my room was impossible. I was in the 8 floor in a corner and i needed to go outside the room to catch the signal, a poor and slowwwww one, why is this, simple the internet has noo key and everybody i mean everybody can us it even in Plaza Cataluña there is free public wifi but even this people take the hotel signal easy faster and less crowded but that makes the guest in the hotel suffer fot the conection. But if you go to this wonderfull city dont wait and stay in Olivia but if you care about internet stay in the first floors.

Reviews.Title: “We really liked it and will stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Kittycosengas
Reviews.Content: Olivia Plaza was very central and the perfect walking distance from every where in barcelona central. The tour bus service across the road was great and there were some lovely cafes near where you could relax in the evenings and watch the world go by. The restaurant in the hotel was impressive and the seating out the back with the glass floors and contemporary design was very interesting and a conversation piece. The hotel staff were extremely accomodating and friendly which is always a plus in any hotel. We loved the fresh feel of the design in the hotel and the clean appearance.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of calm right on Catalunya Plaza”
Reviews.Author: pauljude180
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights for a business meeting in the hotel. I arrived from the airport about 1030 am, but an early check-in was no problem. The room was big and bright, with a double bed, chair, coffee table: not great working space. However there is a business space on the mezzanine level. The washbasin is in effect in the room, but the WC and shower cubicle are hidden behind a sliding door. My colleagues and I all loved the quiet terrace and sunken patio at the rear of the hotel, with the medieval church nearby reflecting in the glass wall. The food was pretty good, but like much of Barcelona there was a faintly unpleasant odor near the basement area where the bar WC is located. The location is great: right beside the airport bus terminus, department stores, the Ramblas, and metro to get further afield. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Married_Couple_Malta
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 9 nights in a superior room at the Olivia Plaza and we absolutely loved it. The staff were great and very helpful. Upon arrival, a complimentary bottle of wine was sent up to our room with a welcome note from the management. It was a nice gesture. The room was modern and clean with a very comfortable bed and bathroom. The only drawback was that we could not open the window, though we had an excellent view of Placa Catalunya. The location is unbeatable....the Metro is very close by at the top of La Rambla and the Aerobus from Airport stops in front of the hotel just across the road. We loved Barcelona and will surely be back. Thanks Olivia Plaza team.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great pisition”
Reviews.Author: Giulio984
Reviews.Content: Pro: - the rooms are nicely disegned and big enough, with a great window. - friendly staff - great breakfast - free wifi (although quite slow) - incredible position Minus: - bathroom - some of the rooms have the window facing the hall of the hotel. It's quite depressing considering the gorgeous view of the other rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A hip, chic, comfortable oasis in the 'chaos' of La Ramblas.”
Reviews.Author: GinaSamarotto
Reviews.Content: This hotel is chic without being stuffy... spacious and well appointed.... and in the very best spot one could hope for in the old city section of Barcelona. Minutes from the cruise docks and steps away from the activities of La Ramblas and if you pre-book, it's an excellent value for the caliber of hotel. The staff was welcoming and helpful, the rooms are spectacular and the food in the restaurant excellent despite having a limited menu.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot”
Reviews.Author: click8123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a family on a 4-day visit to Barcelona. Great location for site-seeing and restaurant options. There are lots of cafes nearby, public transport, etc. It's a touristy area (next to the Hard Rock Cafe) but we were very happy with it. The staff was polite and accommodating. The rooms were nice and modern. Very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Grate Location, Helpful Staff.”
Reviews.Author: Ildarad0
Reviews.Content: My wife and I staid in this hotel for 3 nights while in Barcelona. hotel is one block (short) from La Ramblas and amazing market right off this street. Location is really, really good everything is walking distance. Tour Buses red and Blue line are minute away. you can see bus stops from the window of your room. 2 min walk. Just an advise take a Blue Line its most exciting line. We took all 3 lines (there is also green). I was not impressed by Green line nothing to see. There are # of restaurants in the port foor there is very good. i do not remember the nam of the restaurant but it was second one from the beginning of the street. Also if you really want to have a fine dining restaurant Barceloneta is the must. they have a balcony overlooking the port, in orde to get a table on the balcony you need to specifically request balcony table. otherwise food is excellent. By the way restaurant was recommended by Hotel staff. it was a good recommendation. room is good and spacious, wired and interesting (not bad) there is a one sliding door for bathroom and shower. if you ever staid in A Loft hotels in US, its pretty much the same. restaurant in the Hotel is expensive, for example breakfast if 20euros per person. there are many many small cafes around Plaza Catalunia where hotel is located and you can get breakfast for two people for about 15 euros. things like 2 coffees + a sandwich. hope this helps....

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Laserglo
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at Oliva Plaza before a cruise out of Barcelona. Could not have picked a better location to be in the center of everything. We were very pleasantly surprised to find how quiet our room was, even with non-stop action on the street. The room was clean, bed was good, shower was great. We very much enjoyed the ample breakfast buffet in the morning. We were traveling as a family group of eight people, so we had four rooms. All of us were happy with the hotel, which as you can imagine, does not happen all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great use of space, great breakfasts and service. Highly recommend.”
Reviews.Author: SoloRachAusUK
Reviews.Content: Of course you get what you pay for, and with this hotel you get your moneys worth. The staff were great, the rooms comfortable and clean, free wifi everywhere and it's all happening outside the main entrance. What a great city Barcelona is!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: cardosopat
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the heart of the city. From there you can go anywhere walking or by bus/taxi. The rooms are very nice. The breakfast is expensive, but it can buy it right beside the hotel and take it to your room. Actually we saw a lot of guests doing the same. The internet connection was very high. It's very good!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but NON-user-friendly layout of hotel room”
Reviews.Author: RonnieHongKong
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is good and is easily accessible by taking a Airport bus to the hotel. It is also in downtown area, good for sightseeing and shopping. The hotel receptionists spoke good English and recommended a few good TAPAS restaurants for us. Service was good. We were given a room on the 2nd/Fl but the layout of the room was awful. The room was very small and even worse, it has 2 pillars inside making it very inconvenient to use the water basin or to get into the bed. Please take a look at the attached photo. The lights were too bright.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, interesting room, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Micshu
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel based on tripadvisor recommendations. The location is great - in Plaza Catalunya, near shopping streets and restaurants. The room was very interesting – the sink was right in the entrance and a glass door would isolate either the shower or the toilet seat. Maybe this is not for everybody. The breakfast was decent, nothing spectacular, but ok. The internet was free but poor signal in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Warm recommendation!”
Reviews.Author: libi050
Reviews.Content: A beautifully decorated hotel at the very best location at the middle of barcelona, catalunya plaza. Very nice staff, helpfull and friendly. Large, beautifully decorated and comfortable rooms. And all at a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location if a slightly odd bedroom layout”
Reviews.Author: egyptfan86
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights prior to a cruise. Firstly we arrived early, around 11am, and as expected we were too early to check in which was fair enough. The receptionist said to come back around 1-2pm and so we set off to get tickets for the hop-on hop-off bus, but before we left I asked if we could have a plaza view and she happily said yes. After going around on the bus and lunch at hard rock cafe next door we came back and the receptionist had changed. No worries surely this receptionist will see the notes the last one made about our room specification? nope, we were given a room on the 1st floor overlooking the courtyard. I would usually complain but at this point I didn't have it in me. The room was big, but maybe too big. There was a big empty space between the bed and sofa which is great if you have a family of four who can pull out the sofa, but for a couple it was just odd. The TV was also in an impractical location and almost impossible to watch from the bed (see photo). I agree with past reviews and the lighting system, the lights are just too bright and should have a dimmer switch. Criticisms over, the bathroom area was lovely with rainhead shower and overall the air con was efficient and surprisingly the view from the room was quite nice with a rustic view to the classic spanish buildings around. Breakfast was included in the price and there was a nice selection of hot and cold items. Always seats available and was nice to eat in the conservatory each morning. This hotel seems to cater to a lot of business travellers and americans and at one point over breakfast I did overhear an american not too best pleased with the view from thier room. It seems as though a few rooms look straight onto a wall so would stay away from these. Checking out was no problem however we ordered a taxi through reception for the port but they ended up booking one for the airport! I would recommend this hotel but definately pay the extra for a room overlooking the plaza as these make more use of the space. Location is key here and you could not be in a better location for getting on and off the tourist bus, walking down the ramblas, and walking in the opposite direction for some great restaurants. We ate a Citrus and would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Was cheated of 984Euros - they charged my card even after early cancellation”
Reviews.Author: couchjalapeno
Reviews.Content: 1) They charged my card 984Euros even 2 weeks after I emailed to cancel. - They were supposed to charge after the stay and no charges were supposed to be made if you cancel more than 24 hours before check-in. - I cancelled 3 weeks before check-in. Moreover, when I logged in to their website to check and my reservation was not there. 2) The telephone number on their website is invalid (fake?). Have emailed them to reverse charges - will update this thread when/if I hear from them.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, nice, welcoming, comfortable, free wifi everywhere”
Reviews.Author: ronit10roni
Reviews.Content: I've been to Olivia Plaza Hotel from 11th May to 19th May 2011 by myself, and I highly recommend it because: Location – close to everything that's important: metro, la Rambla, center of interest for the Barcelona inhabitants, minutes from Barri Gotic, jazz clubs, various shopping and food suggestions, cultural halls and masses of people 24h a day. My room was quiet unless it's a carnivalistic night at the plaza downstairs, as happened on the night of the celebration winning of BCN football team, for example. So if you want to avoid noisy unexpected experiences take another hotel. Service – willing and smiling staff, gives quick solution to problem (leak at toilet), helps with buying tickets, makes reservations, and explains ways to getting around. Room – (408 on 4th floor) big even for 2, very nice, with view to plaza Catalunya, very comfortable king-sized bed Free Wifi – in all hotel, including the rooms, whenever you like (enables skype as well) Clean – very, both public area and room. Breakfast – rich, tasty, served in style

Reviews.Title: “Excellent ! Best location possible!”
Reviews.Author: Amoukas
Reviews.Content: Olivia plaza is in my opinion the best 4* hotel one could possibly choose regarding barcelona.in simple words : excellent location,service,food & drinks.rooms are cosy and beautifull.staff was kind and english speaking.The only bad thing is the price...it was a bit expensive but absolutely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Front Desk service”
Reviews.Author: Basiltraveller
Reviews.Content: We are back from our family Easter holidays in Barcelona. The hotel was chosen following the Tripadvisor reviews, as what we mainly needed was central location so we would easily move the family around. The location is just perfect, right near the metro and the tour bus main stops. Clean beautiful rooms, sound proofing in the room could have been better, though. We could hear our neighbours all the time. And the wifi was really slow, however they do have a couple of computers free for the guests on the 1st floor. What we didn't expect was to be presented with such an excellent and helpful service from a couple of the Receptionists there. Our experience regarding service in spanish hotels is certainly awful, however, from the very first minute we stepped into the hotel, all the staff was so friendly. The lady from Bilbao that checked us in couldn't be more amazing, providing us with maps, information, suggestions and above all, smiles... and so went she on during all our stay. Willing to help us and every one else there. My wife was certainly surprised by her speaking so many languages and remembering our children's names! Restaurant service during breakfast can be a bit hectic, so try get a table on the terrace to make up for it. The only down-side is the size of the triple rooms. Not large enough for a family with small children, although they might be good for a short city break. We will be back and recommend this hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Team_MV_Europe2011
Reviews.Content: Hotel Olivia was perfect for our stay in Barcelona. The only gripe I had with this hotel was the lack of iron/ironing board...instead, providing an ironing service at a price of 6 euro's a blouse (what an absolute rip off). The staff were brilliant & very friendly!! The location was perfect...we took the shuttle from the airport straight to & from the city - right across the street from the hotel. My only gripe was not with the hotel but with the people of Barcelona in general, I found them to be extremely rude, & to confirm this, while we were waiting to board our flight (departing Barcelona), 2 rather large locals stood to the back of us in the line & 1 stood directly on my nice new leather suitcase (hand luggage) & then proceeded to say "Thank you" when I moved it from under her foot. RUDE!! Oh, and these locals have NO dress sense - they are very challenged with what looks good on their plump bodies. Oh and one more (just to nail the coffin) - the teenagers have been taught no manners. Unfortunately, there were a bunch of them on our departing flight to which I watched (just after the hostesses had gone through & shut all the overhead compartments) one of the boys reach up to the over head compartment from his seat, throw two backpacks in & then remain seated as opposed to standing up & placing the backpacks in & then closing the compartments...he not only made the hostess come all the way back to close it but he also put those at risk of having luggage fall on their heads. Lazy, loud & ill mannered.

Reviews.Title: “Best location for Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: cyprianc
Reviews.Content: The hotel could not be located better. It is right on the main piazza, where you have access to metro, buses, organized trip buses pick you up in front of the hotel. It's about 50 m from the Las Ramblas the main touristic street. The hotel was great, gave us an upgrade on our arrival just like that without questions asked. Room was specious and clean. The only downfall was a little noise coming from the street but it was bearable, and maybe the wireless internet was not grate. Fantastic breakfast, great selection of pastries.

Reviews.Title: “Olivia Plaza made our Barcelona trip amazing!”
Reviews.Author: themillers8020
Reviews.Content: Plaza de Catalunya is a PERFECT location for all your Barcelona needs. The Olivia Plaza was a dream stay. From the moment we checked-in Reception staff greeted us with friendly smiles and bilingual accents. Their English was very well spoken and we never had a problem with translation. Nowhere in Barcelona did we have an issue. The Hotel was beautiful inside! We checked-in and immediately went to our room and by the time we got there, the Staff had left a personal note from the Manager welcoming our stay. I has speechless on the superb effort that was put in by Olivia Plaza. We had a Superior Room on the 8th floor (10th by US standards) that over looked the Plaza J After figuring out how to turn the lights on (slide key card into light switch LOL) a few moments later Reception called to check to be sure everything was to our liking… OF COURSE it was fantastic!!! The room was very spacious with a beautiful view of the Plaza. Adequate space for clothing (although no dressers, open shelving was provided instead) and a two seat table set was given for viewing the Plaza or my impromptu desk for wifi access. The bathroom was had gorgeous frosted glass windows incasing it including the shower doors and toilet doors. Beware if you traveling with someone you are not comfortable with sharing this type of space with. You can see the outline of the person showering or bathing and there are no locks on the doors. Didn’t bother me and my husband one bit. LOCATION LOCATION! Hard Rock Café is next door and the start to La Ramblas is right on the corner. We walked many a times down that way for dinner, the market, shopping etc. Down the other side of the hotel is another main street that will lead you to more shopping and the Barcelona Cathedral where we enjoyed many of breakfast and lunch outings. Being in the Plaza de Catalunya gives you great access to metro, transit buses, sightseeing buses and taxis galore. I suggest doing the two day hop-on-hop-off bus tours, well worth the money to really see the entire city near and far. We had to check out early 4 AM Reception scheduled a taxi to pick us up. As always the reception was incredibly helpful. After a 30 minute ride to the Airport and $45 euro’s we made it the Airport perfectly. If you have the opportunity, I suggest taking the Aerobus that picks up and drops off at the Airport with several stops in town… it was only $5 euro’s per person J we would have done it for the trip back home, but it didn’t begin service until 6:30 AM. Overall I would completely recommend this Hotel and would definitely stay here again while in Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and good standing”
Reviews.Author: flavien007
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located on the Plaza Cataluna with an amazing view from the room which is spacious with nice shower room. The service of the hotel employees is very courteous. The only problem for me is the price of the garage of 27 euros per day which is expensive taking consideration of the high price of the room. I will come back to this specific hotel for my next visit of Barcelona which is a fantastic city.

Reviews.Title: “Wondefull”
Reviews.Author: Helder G
Reviews.Content: What a wonderfull surprise This hotel. Beautifull room design, fantastic localisation! Must Go there!

Reviews.Title: “Perfecto”
Reviews.Author: TuristaFa
Reviews.Content: A great choice for a business stay in Barcelona. Nicely located in Plaza Cataluna, very close to the Ramblas. Rooms are modern, elegant and super clean..the bathroom is a jewel, try the jacuzzi bath, you will not regret it..

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Staff, Location and Service!”
Reviews.Author: AllThingsWatches
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best I have ever stayed at in regards to the staff and service. The only reason the room got 4 stars vs. 5 was because there was no iron in the room. The staff were incredibly warm and friendly upon checkin. They were eager to help with all of our needs and took their time with us. The breakfast was wonderful and the 13th Century Church wall was a great view every morning as we ate. One morning I wasn't feeling well and the staff were so helpful and wanted to bring breakfast up to the room for me. You can't get better than this. Location is perfect! You are surrounded by shops and restaurants. The metro is a few steps away and Las Ramblas is right around the corner. The room was excellent. Only item as I mentioned was no iron in the room. Very modern and spacious for Europe. Great views. Walls are a bit thin. There is a terrace on the 10th floor with a great view of the city. Whoever is in charge of training the staff here should be praised! Every staff member is friendly and greets you. When in Barcelona make sure to stay here! I was lucky enough to book through www.petrabax.com as they recommended this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: ShaiBT
Reviews.Content: For 1st time tourists in Barcelona this is a great hotel. Hotel is modern, clean, nice rooms, rich breakfast. It's not the romantic, hidden, atmospheric kind a place (difficult to be that when your dead-on Placa Catalunya) but more of a functional no-frills hotel that gives you a good start for each day (due to it's central location) and also a nice place to get back to in the evenings. Location enables you to easily walk both east into the older parts of the city (Gothic quarter, La Rambla, etc) and the beach front but also to the western parts of Eixample, Gracia (Gaudi, shopping, dine/wine). Everything is about 1KM radius allowing you to walk anywhere while all the major public transit systems are just outside the door. The Aerobus to/from the airport (5 euro per direction per person) stops right in front of the hotel. The rooms are quiet (we stayed in a room facing the courtyard in the back) and quite spacious (for an European hotel at this price). The only drawback was it had no open-able window so we had to use the AC although weather outside was great. There is free Wi-Fi in the hotel but it hardly works (rooms or lobby) which was quite annoying. They do have 2 PCs in their lounge for guests so we managed. The staff was friendly and helpful (and knew relatively good English).

Reviews.Title: “Some Good and Some Bad”
Reviews.Author: Eurotraveler55
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean and modern. The rooms are actually spacious (which is hard to find in Europe). The location is good for sightseeing as it is on Placa de Catalunya and next to La Ramblas. Also, it is very convinient for the metro and the airport shuttle drops you off and picks you up right infront of the hotel. The bad things about the hotel...1.) On the last night and day there was no water pressure. I got in the shower and suddenly the water turned brown. My husband called the front desk and they told him they knew about the problem. HELLO! If you knew the water was turning brown, shouldn't you warn your guests? 2.) One very very rude receptionist (she was so bad that she outweighed the others that were fairly nice/polite). I asked her if she could help me find the phone number for my airline because they lost my bag. She told me "no". Two days later, I was sitting in the lobby and heard her helping another guest who had lost his bag. She called 5 offices of that airline for this guy and kept telling him how it was her job to help and she was happy to do it. Ok...so I guess his money was more valuable at the hotel than mine. He didn't look like anyone important...so I wasn't sure what her deal was. I didn't ask her to call anyone...just to look up a number for me (and she was just standing there doing nothing when I asked her). 3.) The walls are thin in the hotel. We could hear other guests doing things (use your imagination)! 4.) Although convinient for sightseeing, all the restaurants within a 10 minute walking radius of the hotel seemed like tourist traps. For the money I spent for this hotel, and the 4-star rating it has, I expect nice rooms AND nice service (or atleast polite staff). I will spend my money at another 4-star hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “No Iron, No Air con, Cold Breakfast...”
Reviews.Author: BellagioBilly
Reviews.Content: Had it not been for a few silly niggles which could easily be resolved, this would be a great hotel. It's modern and very well located, however a few fundamental errors resulted in a tarnished stay. Firstly there are no irons in the rooms. Upon questioning this with reception, the answer I was given was that it's because not many people know how to use them ! They went on to say that the only option was to use the hotels laundry service (£4 per shirt for ironing) The room was also uncomfortably hot as the air con was set at 20'c. Every time we tried to turn it down, it went straight back up to 20'. When querying this with reception they said it was the law that rooms could not be lower than 20'c for 'environmental reasons' and that it was the goverment to blame. As we had an internal room overlooking the lobby rather than a window with view outside, they offered to open our only window which looked down onto the lobby (previously locked with no handle) In doing this cooled the room slightly, however sleep was still interrupted with noise from the lobby and bar below, so no better off. Drilling and noisy building works in the room next door at 8am on out 1st morning also quashed any chances of a relaxing lie in. Breakfast has a reasonable spread but the cooked breakfast section was cold on every day - maybe I should have took it up to the room to warm it up !

Reviews.Title: “If anything this Hotel is getting better!”
Reviews.Author: Peter_Bromley
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay here in 2009 when I was last in Barcelona so it was an obvious place to choose when I took my daughter there in November. I was keen to know how, if at all, the place had changed. So often time passes and standards slip but over 16 months I have to say that I am pleased to report that the Olivia Plaza has got better. Welcomed as a returning guest we were given superb rooms on eth 8th floor, of 10, with magnificent views over the main square in the region. Despite being full, or nearly so, (not a surprise if everyone experiences the quality I did) the staff were attentive, helpful and most of all friendly wanting only to make our stay enjoyable.
