With the Metro and information centre on the doorstep, tour busses and taxis available in the square and its central location making walking tours possible this hotel has, in my view, the BEST location in the city. The Ramblas joins the square only yards away and the area is teeming with shops, museums, restaurants and cafe's in abundance. The rooms are spacious and well equipped, there is free internet available and we received a welcome tray on arrival - a nice touch. I cannot recommend the Olivia highly enough and would certainly stay there again whenever I visit Barcelona - which I'm sure I will in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but Expensive”
Reviews.Author: John_Michael_C
Reviews.Content: Great hotel directly on the square north of the old town, although surrounding by tourist stores (e.g. ice cream store). Once inside, it had an excellent atmosphere, clean (if exceedingly modern) rooms, and great views. Highly recommended when in Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ReliableReviews7
Reviews.Content: Overall, this hotel was terrific. The rooms are not ideal for sharing a room with two friends, but overall, the hotel is wonderful The rooms are slightly small and the location is central, but the plaza is not the nicest in Spain. The breakfast is very good. Overall, Barcelona is a great city and this hotel was terrific.

Reviews.Title: “wow wow wow”
Reviews.Author: gsvij
Reviews.Content: wow loved the place. Staff very nice, rooms sexy, location u cant beat this. Take aerobus from the airport drops u right outside the hotel. checkin leave ur bags get out and every thing is around you shopping eating bars name it. rooms very nice. Reception staff too good

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hotel in the Heart of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: G0everywhere
Reviews.Content: I have traveled to Barcelona in June with a friend, and we were looking for a more upscale hotel to spend our 8 days of vacation. We could not be appier with Plaza Olivia. The hotel interior itself is magnificent, everything seemed very new and crispy clean. A separate thank you to the staff, as they went an extra mile in offering suggestions for the restaraunts to go, places to visit and ways to get there. The hotel itself sits on top of the Plaza Catalunia metro station, and all the Barcelona attractions are 10-15 minutes away! My only complain about the hotel is a lack of privacy in the bathroom and shower area, which are rather small and separated from the room corridor by muted glass (so you can def see shades). One definite suggestion i can offer is - get the breakfast from the hotel! It is a bit pricey (20 euro) but it is VERY filling.

Reviews.Title: “Very modern - except the plumbing and electricity!”
Reviews.Author: amrDC
Reviews.Content: When I walked into my standard single (#411) , I thought, "wow, what a great and modern design." The space was well-used as the vanity was in the open room, with a sliding glass door that gave access to either the shower or the toilette. This was problematic, as the shower didn't drain, and water spilled over the sliding door's runner and all over the vanity area. It was a huge mess of water, and an employee came to look, gasped at the damage, and promised the drain would be cleared. THE DRAIN NEVER CLEARED! Also, the lights in my room would randomly flicker on about 4 times a night. I COULDN'T SLEEP. On the positive side, this hotel has an amazing location off the Placa Catalunia and the staff was polite. It also offers free internet, with access to two computers. Finally, the restaurant has great sangria. Since I am a light sleeper, and I like to take more than a 5 minute shower, I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “More than PERFECT!”
Reviews.Author: seniorsdoc72
Reviews.Content: Ok first of all there's not enough words for how great this place was! Location was phenomenal right next to Hard Rock but not on the busiest street Las Ramblas but so close to it. It's in the heart of Catalunya which was perfect. One hint for people to save money for your arrival take the Airport bus because it's only 5 euros and brings you in the middle of Catalunya and you only have to walk a few steps to the hotel. It runs every 15-30 minutes. So worth it! Taxi is 30 euros! As for the hotel the rooms were huge and free internet in the rooms. The staff wasn't the brightest bunch so I'd do my research on the internet before asking them anything. The only catch is the bathrooms are see through so no modesty here. And ask for a room on the other side of the main plaza or it'll be noisy at night. I loved Barcelona and this hotel made it even more enjoyable. I'd absolutely go back and absolutely stay here. It's pricey but well worth it in terms of saving money on transportation expenses. Don't get the breakfast because there's a nice coffee shop next door that's much cheaper and has delicious pastries and coffee. Also you MUST do the sight-seeing on the hop on and hop off buses. It takes you to all the major sites for one price and runs all hours of the day. And it's right in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel even better People :)”
Reviews.Author: D4Dave2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location for getting around in Barcelona, We went for a 3 day short break and were very lucky to be given room 804, the views to the sea over the Cathedral were breath-taking and the sunrise was a great welcome each morning. The folks were all lovely and the hotel is spotless, reasonably priced bar/mini bar and all in all great value for money. I would definitely go back to this hotel if I go back to Barcelona. I would only offer you one thought about a short break in Barcelona, walk off the beaten track when you’re looking for a beer/coffee/lunch/dinner the good places (the ones that make your holiday) are not on the main tourist roads/routes, wander off the path and you will find the places that you will remember. That said the best bar for sun kissed beer later in the day was on the left hand side at the bottom of the port end of Las Ramblas sit outside and watch the world go by :)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: mover1111
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. The service at the hotel was very good. We had cocktails on the glass bottom patio and enjoyed the nice ambiance. The room was clean, beds were comfortable, and we have a very interesting view of the city. I would recommend a stay here while in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in the City”
Reviews.Author: TravelTrollKent
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Olivia for 5 days on the first week in October. On arrival the Receptionist was welcoming and pleasant and our check in was quick and efficient. Porter service was good. We were very pleased to be given a room on the first floor overlooking the City Square. Although the square was extremely busy, and traffic was right outside the window, we found the room to be quiet and we were not disturbed by the noise to any extent, and it was very quiet at night. Rooms were a good size. Bed was big and comfortable. Room facilities and toiletries were good, and we found the room to be very clean. The lack of privacy from the toilet and shower noted by some reviewers is correct; hardly an issue for us after 25 years of marriage, but it could certainly be an issue if you have kids with you. We had breakfast included in our booking and found it to be more than adequate. Breakfast was served on the Terrace which was nice in the mornings, with very helpful service by the staff. We stopped in the Terrace Bar for a nightcap every evening and found the service to be first-class. Location is totally perfect. Situated on the city square, it is ideal for tourist buses which all run from the square, and the Metro. Ideal for exploring Las Ramblas and the main shopping streets. Major Department Stores are adjacent to the hotel. The Metro was very cheap, less than 3 Euros for two tickets and a really safe and efficient way to buzz around the city to the major tourist spots, but we did a lot of walking. Thanks to the central location of the hotel, it was perfect for visiting anywhere in the City and easy to return to when your wife has a pile of shopping bags to drop off, or a quick change of clothes if the weather alters. Lots of restaurants, cafes and bars within a short stroll of the hotel. Overall we found all the hotel staff to be very friendly and helpful, from receptionists to room staff, and the hotel to be of a high standard. We had a wonderful time in Barcelona, and we would certainly have no hesitation in staying at the Olivia if we came back again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and Experience”
Reviews.Author: Travelbuff33
Reviews.Content: Hotel Staff were fabulous, location perfect to all sights and activities, clean, quiet, and generally perfect. We would stay again and have seen the other hotels in area and think the value for money is ideal. Staff were so accomodating and genuine that it felt easy to settle in.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel - great location!”
Reviews.Author: bb0ys
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, very good service & excellent facilities. We stayed for 4 nigths. Near Hard Rock Cafe. The only minor issue was that we heard the people in the room next door, that was sometimes annoying. However, oveall a great stay and a great hotel with really helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: suefromCalif
Reviews.Content: The airport bus leaves you off just on the other side of Placa Catalunya. Couldn't be any more centrally located. The hop-on-bus for tourism is just across the street and Las Ramblas is just around the corner. The room is modern and minimalist. The door to the shower slides sideways and is also the door for the separate toilet. There is a glass panel on the side of the shower that lets too much light into the bedroom area from the sink area. I would certainly stay here again if returning to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff, restaurant”
Reviews.Author: MamaBarBar
Reviews.Content: We just stayed one day and found this to be in a great location. Right near Las Ramblas and other historic parts of town. Easy access to the metro. Next to Hard Rock Cafe. The restaurant has an outside area that was wonderful. Try the Sangria. The staff was great too. Even though the hotel was on a busy street we found the room to be quiet. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: YoavJerusalem
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel in the evening and although we were a group and the rooms were fully prepaid, they asked for separate check-in for each member.All the rooms facing the plaza were double beded so me and my partner could not change rooms to have a view.We got in the room(the bell boy had a very cold attitude) and in two minutes we discovered thet the safe was not working.The maintanance man was, once again the bell boy.He found out that the safe did not have even batteries to make it functional! Hello-who has to check this before the guest checks in ? When we separated the beds we saw a bit of dirt or something.It was clear that no vacum mashine visited that corner. The next huge problem was the fact that the toillet and the shower(no tube) were not hidden or separated by a wall but part of the room! It was very inconveniant and we decided thet each time one of us will us the public toilets in the hotel. Next:each time you go in the room or leave the room the electrical curtains are activated.You want it or not they go up and down for about two minutes. Next: the walls between the rooms (202 was our room) and any of the next rooms is so thin that you can hear word by word what is spoken next door.In one occasion I was tired and tried to rest in the afternoon and I hear the phone ringing.Only after I got up I realised that it was the phone from an adiacent room which was ringing.By the way,we could here perfectly the next room's curtaind going up and down and up again. Next: there was no closet to arange your clothes.We came for five days so we quite had some stuff.They have only hangers and the sholf on the floor and a shelf up-up where you need a chair to reach it.Very frustating. The hotel has two free internet stations but one of them was not working.Sorry,I did not bather myself to tell them. We had also some problems while making the reservation:the hotel did not accept direct reservation and we did it by internet !Hello-what's the problem with you ? Finaly ,we enjoyed our breakfast.Very nicely arranged and a big variety (as much as European hotels give !)Only sliced fresh tomatoes were served as vegetables but other items were ok. Well that is.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: FunkeyMunkey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Olivia Plaza in January 2010 myself, my husband and 5 year old son. The first thing I will say is that the location is PERFECT!! You really can't get a more central and convenient location in Barcelona. Step out of the hotel and turn left and you are right on Las Ramblas. A metro stop is directly opposite which is extemely convenient and cheap, as is the stop for the airport bus and open topped tour bus. The hotel itself was very nicely decorated, clean and comfotable (bed was very comfortable!) Also breakfast was good with lots of choice and certainly sets you up for the day. I got ot a very good deal via yeego.com the price for this hotel being almost half of what was quoted by other companies making it a bargain in my opinion (but perhaps because this was January?). Only slight negatives I would mention are:- the shower and toilet share a glass door (i.e. when the toilet door is closed the shower door is open) however not a problem for us as we were a family sharing the room. Also the size of the room was a little on the small side especially we we opened up the sofa bed for our son to sleep on, it was a real squeeze, but again not really a problem and expected in Europe. Overall I would highly recommed this hotel, especially for the location. We fell in love with Barcelona which is a truly amazing and very friendly city!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelingOYEster
Reviews.Content: Olivia Plaza is in the center of everything. The hotel is super clean and modern. The staff is helpful, but some of the staff's English isn't perfect so make sure you get the correct answer vs. a nod of yes. You can take the bus from the airport and back for 5 Euro. The hotel breakfast is expensive, so feel free to walk around the corner to numerous food options. The AC is great. I had a room for 2 nights with my mom prior to a cruise and we chose to come back following the cruise due to the location. The only complaint I have is that the pillows aren't standard pillows and not very comfortable. Other than that one small minor detail, this is a wonderful hotel for a short stay (I say short as it is very expensive compared to the other places I spent time at in Barcelona).

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL, FANTASTIC LOCATION, LOVELY BFAST, VERY NICE STAFF”
Reviews.Author: gejsha
Reviews.Content: stayed here for a weekend 27-29.8.2010 and was more than happy , got a great deal as we had vouchers and had bfast included in the price.rooms were spacious, the layot with the bathroom ids really cool & different, all amenities including. We had a fantastic time and staff made us feel very welcome, will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very modern hotel but not that great”
Reviews.Author: Orlando2011
Reviews.Content: Stayed with husband last year in september for a post cruise one night stay in Barcelona. Arrived from the port very early (around 8am) so our room was not ready. The staff was friendly and advised we could leave our luggage in their deposit until checkin time. We left the hotel to do our final day of sightseeing (Parc Guell) and returned around 4 pm to checkin. Room was definitely very modern, large and beautifully decorated just as I had expected. For some reason though our room among all its modernness was a bit unconfortable. The bathroom was integrated to the bedroom (bad idea) so you really had no privacy if you wanted to shave or dry your hair or anything! The toilet was an enclosed space accessible by a laminated glass door which when closed still showed the person's entire profile sitting in the toilet from outside..not very pleasant. Shower was also a small enclosed space which made you a bit claustrofobic..also accessible by a laminated glass door. Bed was king sized and very comfy. Our room on the 3rd floor overlooked the atrium and the restaurant on the ground floor. Quite noisy at night which made it hard to fall asleep. Didn't have breakfast as it was not included. Check out was very early but fast and painless. The hotel is located right in front of Plaza Catalunya so it was just a short walk to the Aerobus stop to catch the bus to the airport. The hotel is also located two buildings away from the Hard Rock Cafe and across the street is a huge Corte Ingles. Overall the hotel was very lovely in its style and decor which was exactly what I was looking for but resulted a bit unconfortable and I'm not sure if I would return if for no other reason than its great location.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and a nice location”
Reviews.Author: joseph2009Sydney
Reviews.Content: This is a very modern hotel with trendy decor and facilities. The location is excellent right in the middle of one of the busiest squares in Barcelona that has restauraunts, shops, train stations and bus route stops at their door stop. The rooms are spacious by european standards and the hotel has a lovely restaurant that is raised above the ground with glass see through flooring. The service and food is quite good here, and which also doubles as the buffet breakfast place. The breakfast is quite good. Try to book with the breakfast included in the room price otherwise it will be expensive. Only downside is that rooms are probably more geared towards couples than families as the shower and toilet walls are etched glass (you can see body shapes) while the change area is just outside the shower with not much privacy. This may be fine if you are a nudist (you will love this) or a couple but for people dragging along kids it can be problematic. So be aware! I would recommend this hotel highly though if you are not too bothered about shower and change room privacy..

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary chic, friendly and helpful staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: Soleil058
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from a hen weekend in Barcelone with some friends and had a fabulous time. I can't recommend this hotel enough. All the staff, from the receptionist to the doorman went out of their way to make our stay as comfortable and enjoyable as possible. The rooms were air-conditioned and very clean and the decor throughout the hotel was very chic and elegant with great attention to detail. Computer access with free internet was available which made life a lot easier. The hotel was very near to Las Ramblas and within walking distance to most of the major attractions. I will certainly be staying there again when I next visit Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: GentlePetal
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Olivia Plaza. This hotel is a little outside the square with ultra modern rooms and brave colour schemes. Its location is brilliant, being in the Plaza Catalunya next door to the Hard Rock Café and a few steps away from lots of shops and La Rambla. The place was buzzing. Our room was comfortable but odd, being situated in the centre of the hotel with no natural light. The glass door in place of a window opened on to a corridor so we had to keep the curtain closed for privacy. Nor were we keen on the open plan bathroom right next to the door. They were the only things that let the hotel down. That aside, it was a great place to stay and the staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Location can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: TheRedUmbrella
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to be closest to all the busy streets, metro and shopping, this would be considered the most centrally located hotel in Barcelona. Theres a lot of dining options nearby that is open late, but convenience stores that were open were difficult to locate at night. Being located in a busy square such as Plaza Catalunya made us feel safe getting back to the hotel late at night. Service-wise, the doorman and bellboy were great and always had a smile on their face. However, the check-in counter staff, while helpful and efficient, didn't seem to emit the same level of friendliness. We obtained rates at 40% off through a travel deal website and obtained rooms at 99EUR per night which was a great deal considering the location and star rating of the hotel. I don't think the value is there if you were to pay the regular room rates (179-200EUR) as the rooms were small and didn't give me the impression that the furnishings or designs were of the highest quality. Carpet flooring would have been preferred as oppose to the vinyl woven-textured flooring by the bed area as we noticed permanent red marks on the floor. The common areas however were fantastic, beautiful, modern, and we would have only wished that the rooms were of the same quality and feel. We faced the courtyard on the 3rd floor which was quiet and nice, but I would have preferred a room looking over the plaza. Overall, because of the location and that the hotel appeared quite new, I would recommend staying here if you are able to obtain a good rate and only if you are staying for a few days. If you are staying for a week in Barcelona, I would recommend staying here for the first few days so that you can see all the attractions and shopping that Barcelona has to offer, before ending your trip with a couple of days in a more luxurious hotel such as the W Barcelona which has far more amenitities and a better vibe to end off a trip in an amazing city.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome :o)”
Reviews.Author: Sulshy
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and location with easy access to the aerobus, city tour bus (a must) and all the other Barcelona attractions. We found everything clean and the WiFi worked well in the room. Breafast a treat and served at decent times (until 11am weekdays and 11:30am at weekends). As it was very central we thought it may be busy and noisey but NO, there was always staff on hand and they were extremely competent. Rooms nice size and well designed for a couple like us but not sure whether the bathroom design woud be family friendly. The only downside was the lack of pool and distance to the beach if you would like relax close to the water but still a lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel; Great location”
Reviews.Author: tsahai85
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in June. We followed the advise of other reviewers and took the Aerobus ($5pp) which was quick and convenient. The hotel lobby is lovely and the check in was quick and efficient. We got in at 11am and even though check in is not until ater 3 the reception noted that by this point we had been awake for more almost 24 hours of travlling and so got the room ready faster. While we waited we had a snack next door at a cafe Farggi--which is where we also had a much cheaper breakfast than what was offered at the hotel--and rode the hop-on/hop-off bus which stops almost in front of the hotel. Since you are in the main square everything is close by and we walked LaRambla to the beach and the market. Great hotel, great service!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ANO83
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights in a Terrace Superior room. - Check in was fast and efficient. - The location of this hotel is great. In the center of Plaça de Catalunya. You just walk out of the hotel and you are in the middle of everything. - The room is stylish but the furniture felt a little cheap quality. - The room is clean, but for the entire time we stayed their they did not change the bed sheets. I called the room service more than 3 times asking them to change the sheets but their response was always we will send someone to change them but no one came. - If you take a long shower the water will just start leaking out of the bathroom into the changing area. - When you flush the toilet sometimes some water would leak into the changing area. - The internet wifi is free and fast which is really great. If I go back there I would stay in this hotel only for its great location.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Miguel&Tulio
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel and our 4 nights stay was a pleasure. We arrived at a one days' notice and were treated like treasure. The Olivia Plaza hotel is perfectly located in the heart of Barcelona and it's location is hard to beat. Our superior room was great, from the top floor, after a long day wondering around, life does look better. The design is interesting with the bath tub right next to the double bed... it is romantic. The room was large, colorful and we loved it. I would consider it combines a good balance of price to comfort ratio. The staff is pro and helpful day and night and they sort out any wish we had. I would highly recommend it to anyone. Privacy can be an issue. The shower and toilet walls were glass, and not sound proof... The room was generally clean but the maid was not that attentive to the fine details that make it stand out. In the year 2010 Internet is a must! The WiFi is mostly useless and there is no other available connection in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Bring noise cancelling headphones”
Reviews.Author: Staten7
Reviews.Content: Olivia Plaza is a very nice, modern and stylish hotel that couldn't be more centrally located for tourism. It is right on the Placa de Catalunya where Las Ramblas starts, the tourist buses gather and the Aerobus from the airport drops you off. But being right on the Placa means you hear how popular and bustling this place is at all hours of the day and night if your room overlooks it. Interior rooms are MUCH quieter and highly recommended. The staff are very attentive and nice and the breakfast is pretty good. They have a nice enclosed but open to the air patio where breakfast is served. We stayed in a standard, interior room the first night - quiet but very small (but highly functional). Good for one person but cramped for two. After that we upgraded to a suite. These are very luxurious (by European standards) featuring a jacuzzi tub large sitting room and full floor to ceiling views. That's the good and the bad. Doesn't matter how high a floor you are on as sound travels up through the placa. If you want to be right in the thick of things, this is the place to stay. If you are looking for something less busy, go into Barri Gothic.

Reviews.Title: “very comfy and modern”
Reviews.Author: gonefishingPerth
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel and pleasant staff. In a very convenient location - a stone throw away from Placa Catalunya, buses direct to and from airport, Information stand, cafes, shops. Rates rather high for a 4 stars hotel, paid AU$204 for a Sunday night and $248 for a Monday night (without breakfast) and apparently it was discounted! We stayed 4 nights at another 4 stars hotel at the end part of our 12 days trip to Spain and it was only AU$172 per night , it was just as lovely and comfortable, except 10 minutes further away from Placa Catalunya. Worth it to shop around for special deals.

Reviews.Title: “The Olivia Plaza is the perfect place to stay in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: lavatera
Reviews.Content: The Olivia Plaza combines the best of Barcelona. Right on the Plaza Cataluyna, in under 5 minutes, you can walk to Las Ramblas, fabulous shopping, excellent restaurants, the Blue Line sightseeing bus and the aero bus to the airport ( gorgeous, modern bus designed for airport shuttles. 5 Euros!). Yet, once inside the hotel, it is quiet and elegant. Our ultra modern rooms were lovely and comfortable. Our teenagers loved the atmosphere. The staff was most accommodating. They spoke excellent English, gave us all kinds of local insight and were most friendly. The breakfast is a little spendy so we ate at the amazing Mercado. Considering the high quality of the facility the prices are moderate. Our room for 2 people was 140 Euros. The big room for our teenagers, which slept 5 people, was 215 Euros. Very few local hotels offer this kind of room. We loved this hotel and will stay there when we return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but smelly room”
Reviews.Author: spottyladybird
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in great location. We caught bus from the airport and only a short walk to the hotel. The hotel is located in the centre where you can visit plenty of restaurants. The hotel is nice and cosy. But the rolling blind wasnt working hence we were woken up very early in the morning. The sewage system must be failing, as our room was okay on the first night but not for subsequent nights. The lady down in the bar is very helpful. The concierge is great!!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant choice for Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: PrincesaUK
Reviews.Content: I spent a long weekend at the Olivia Plaza in February 2010. Location - The first thing I have to say about it is that I don't think that there could be a better location to stay in Barcelona. It was perfectly situated on the Plaza de Catalunya. The Aerobus (from Barcelona airport) stops at the Plaza de Catalunya and there are also stops for the Bus Turistic (the sightseeing bus with three different routes that travels around Barcelona - would definately recommend!!!!!), as well as plenty of places to eat and drink. Cleanliness - The cleanliness of the hotel was perfect, can't be faulted in any way. Rooms - We had a room overlooking the atrium, there was outside noise from the atrium but not so much as to bother us at all. However, we had a window which overlooked the lifts and therefore had to keep the curtains closed all the time otherwise everybody could see straight in. The rooms were modern, flat screen television (although only Spanish channels), minibar, comfortable double bed. The bathroom area was spacious. Toilet cubicle very small though! Also, take care when having a shower because there is a two inch gap between the door and the floor and very easy to flood the room! Service - The staff were brilliant! Reception staff helpful and attentive. One of the doormen, don't remember his name, was extremely helpful, always suggesting things for us to do and go and see and where there was free entry. Only negative thing I would say is that, sometimes we wanted to go back to the room for an hour in the afternoon to freshen up and relax and the room still hadn't been made up, sometimes not until after 3 or 4pm. I would recommend this hotel, but perhaps request a room overlooking the Plaza de Catalunya. With regard to Barcelona itself, the Bus Turistic was the perfect way to travel around the city and see the main sights. Also, if you get chance, there is a tram and funicular railway up to Tibidabo and we would definately recommend going up. The views were fantastic! Also, if you go on the Bus Turistic they give you a voucher book with offers for many attractions and food places. We had a perfect trip to Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: CampaspeLondon
Reviews.Content: The hotel ticks almost all of the boxes... great location, good size room, and professional day time staff. Location is right at the midpoint of major attractions. Most sights are either walkable or reachable via a short bus ride. The T-10 ticket was adequate over 4 days for 2 people. Airport bus was also a good value. The room was a comfortable size, but privacy can be an issue. The shower and toilet walls were glass, and not sound proof. The room was generally clean... not immaculate but good enough. The staff were night and day in quality. The night staff was flakey. We asked someone to move forward a dinner reservation... this person didn't call the restro until at least one hour later... by then we already ordered and were drinking our first glass of wine. This was despite us giving them the name and phone number of the restaurant. There was one day when the cleaner came in the mid-afternoon while we were in the room. When we left early in the evening, we asked for the room to be cleaned. Not only did it not happen, we were told that it was because we had the "do not disturb" sign on the door. Not true. We were also given a horrible room initially when we checked in. The phone didn't work. There were shoeprints in the shower. The blinds wouldn't open. When we asked for a different room, the night staff at first said that the hotel was fully booked, but did relent eventually. The day staff was really good, from the front desk to the bellmen. Internet was wacky. Couldn't get to non-Spainish websites. But we had no problems in Starbucks. No support from the hotel on internet problems. It's a shame when a hotel falls short on multiple small service related issues. I would return, but this would not be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “It was one of the best hotels in my trip around spain. Amazing Location.”
Reviews.Author: LeoBessa
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect, betwee plaza cataluna and LA RAMBLA. Besides the great movement, it is quietly hotel. And more, it is like a design hotel, with very beautiful rooms and a great restaurant. The price it is not the better, but, for that hotel, worths. Recomend for every tourist who wants a good hotel to meet barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't wish for a better stay in an amazing city!”
Reviews.Author: Foxy304
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect - right in the center of everything. Literally, just steps from La Rambla, Barri Gotic, Tourist Buses, Subway and Shopping Mall. Very convenient. Hotel and rooms are very modern and functional, yet cozy. We've stayed in suite facing the Placa Catalunya - great view and surprisingly quiet. Staff was very attentive, friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a quick stay, or for a business traveler”
Reviews.Author: travelingblue
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with some friends back on September of 2008. We were returning from a 7 night, Mediterranean cruise. We stayed only for one night, because we were scheduled to return home (U.S.) the day after. The hotel was definetely modern, and had a very clean look to it. I don't know what year it opened for business, but it looked new at the time. The staff was very professional, and to the point. The rooms were also modern. The window drapes were controlled by an electronic buttom on the wall. The bathroom area, though small, was built with all modern and innovative fixtures and details. Our room had a king size bed, and sofa bed; both big, clean, and confortable. I believe it is on the second floor, there were about 3 computers with free internet access. We did not eat anything at the hotel, so I cannot provide any opinion on that. The hotel itself is about 10 steps from Las Ramblas, and directly in front of a main plaza (don't remember the name of the plaza at this time). Also, for those who care to know, there was both a burger king and a mc donalds about half a block away. As you walk outside of the hotel, immediately to your right there is a small cafeteria. I had an ice cream, and later some coffee; the dulce the leche ice cream was amazing, and the expresso was very good. There are definetely plenty of things to do, see, and eat around the hotel. All in all, though I only stayed here for one night, I really cannot come up with any complaints. If I recall correctly, we paid approximately the equivalent of $200 dollars the night. My only other opinion was that the hotel, even though it had about 4 floors, seemed to have everything kind of cramped up. However, whoever did the hotel did a great job. I would very likely stay here again, but only for a short visit. In my opinion its not a hotel where you would want to spend more than 2 or 3 days. Therefore, I think its probably good for those staying for short visits, or on business.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: Cozzeville
Reviews.Content: Found the hotel to be very good. Not at all noisy considering you are over the Place catalunya. Definately better than staying looking over Las Ramblas. Didnt stay for breakfast as it was expensive for what it was, but we had a nose at it and it all looked good. Staff were very freindly and helpful. Terrace rooms overlooking the Plaza are not good value. The balcony is very high so you cannot see any view unless you are standing up. You cannot sit and watch the world go by or even from the comfort of your room. Bed was nice and firm, but working out the light system was a little difficult and frustrating. Found the greatest ice cream parlor outside of Italy!!!! Called Gelaaati on Llibreteria 7. www.gelaaati.com. fantastic and the girls are lovely.!!!! Barcelona is surprisingly good for pastries and cakes. The wine is FANTASTIC and cheap. They dont sell it by the glass in restaurants, but by the bottle. But it is so cheap that you are only paying about 7 - 10 GBP per bottle.

Reviews.Title: “perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Emmaelle73
Reviews.Content: The perfect place to be in barcelona to enjoy the old downtown and its nightlife. Nice staff, elegant design hotel and perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff - nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: sarahian
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Olivia Plaza hotel for 3 nights. The hotel is modern and clean. The staff are very friendly and are very helpful. The check in process was simple and quick. The hotel room was spacious and clean and very modern. Loved the shower. The window was floor to ceiling and had great views over the city to the sea (could even see the spires of the Cathedral). The room was quiet (although we were at the back of the hotel so didn't have any traffic noise). The only point to note was that the breakfast was expensive, however we find that the breakfasts in hotels are generally not cheap - would be worth getting it as part of your hotel stay if you can. The choice for breakfast was good and there was always plenty on offer (the items were always being replenished). The drinks at the bar were surprisingly cheap (compared to bars just off Ramblas). It was nice sitting out on the terrace bar with a glass of wine, We would recommend this hotel as it is very centrally located - on catalunya Plaza and just next to the Ramblas. Also the airport bus is recommended (just opposite hotel - save you a fortune in Taxi fares and only takes about 25-30 mins. We would stay at this hotel again should we go back to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Staff here are exceedingly pleasant and...”
Reviews.Author: andybevrose
Reviews.Content: Staff here are exceedingly pleasant and helpful. Hotel is in a great location. We didn't there but would have no hesitation returning in the future

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravellingTrevLondon
Reviews.Content: A modern, stylish hotel right in Cataluna Square, so you couldn't really be better located in central Barcelona. Given the location, it was very quiet, though we had a room at the back. From the Concierge onwards the staff were very professional and helpful too. Very little to fault, the only mishap was ordering breakfast in the room for Monday morning, which didn't turn up. They were most apologetic, however. Perhaps the room was a little small, but they it was decorated with simple, stylish elegance that made the room a pleasure to return to. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: jyc510
Reviews.Content: Location can't be beat. I usually stay at high-end boutique hotels, but as a solo traveler in a foreign country where I did not speak the language well, it was a good home base that was easy to find. The design was modern, although it could use a fresh coat of paint and a closer inspection by hotel operations. The lobby was very nice, fresh yet cozy. Staff was very attentive. The doorman gave tidbits on where to go on certain days. Check in and out was easy and painless.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location, freindly service”
Reviews.Author: Paul106
Reviews.Content: Perfect location on main square in Barcelona. Had Superior Room with Terrace on 9th floor, i woudl recommend this to anyone thinking of staying. Excellent view from terrace, nice to sit out and drink, eat and relax. Staff very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, friendly and very central.”
Reviews.Author: Cptjhols
Reviews.Content: In a faulously central location on Plaza Cataluyna, just at the top of La Ramblas it's easy to get to by any mode of transport. We got the train and underground from the airport which took about 1 hour and brought us out at Cataluyna Metro - directly across from the hotel however we got the airport bus back which took about 20 mins and was 5e each. Taxis are expensive - if you do want one just get it from the rank opposite the hotel - we asked the hotel to call one and it was 10e before we left as they start the meter runnnig before you get in. Th hotel itself is relatively clean and our room had a beautiful view into the back courtyard and across the rooftops. It's really birght and open feeling - it was previously an office block before being converted about 5 years ago. Decor is simple and modern - very nice. Only one thing I wasn't so keen on was the sliding glass door for the toilet / shower, not room for much privacy so you have to be very close to the person you are with!! Hotel staff were all fantastic, very polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location & Modern Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: lilair
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with My husband and another couple in May 2007 (a little late on my review) but better late then never. I'll keep this short...I am a very picky traveler! to the point where I wouldn't stay in some 5 star resorts because they don't meet my criteria. I usually bring my own sheets and towels to the hotel (just in case) but didn't need them here. The location of the hotel is A+ right in the center of it all. The rooms were ultra modern and super clean. The staff was really friendly (we weren't really in the hotel all that much but when we did see them we felt they were great). If you're young and want to stay in a trendy hotel this is it!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Helga88
Reviews.Content: I do not have one bad word to say about this hotel. The location, the staff & service, the cool design, the fantastic view, the comfy beds. Everything was on the spot! We were celebrating our 6th aniversary and had cava and strawberries waiting for us in our room. The view was breathtaking and - staying in room 1008 - we were one door away from the roof terrace, which we had pretty much to ourselves. The heated outdoor bar downstairs with glass floor was very chic and great for pre- og post dinner drinks. We will definitely stay here the next time we go to Barcelona. Thank you for making our anniversary weekend even more perfect!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location...worth the price”
Reviews.Author: wilhem_7
Reviews.Content: Olivia Plaza Hotel is right on Plaza Catalunya, which means the metro, Las Ramblas, Aerobus to and from the airport, Hop on Hop Off bus are all within about 50 metres. It is also an easy walk to old town, cathedrals, cafes and restuarants. We happened to be there when the annual fiesta (La Merci) was on and Barcelona was amazingly vibrant and busy. We experienced parades, concerts, displays, and cultural competitions. Our room was a top floor room with a large balcony overlooking the Plaza where concerts were on each night of the fiesta. Sitting on the balcony, sipping local wine and enjoying a mezzo plate while watching and listening was a treat. You could also do some people watching from there: street dancing, buskers, tourists and locals. The room itself was large by European standards and yes the bathroom is trendy and open plan. It is generally a trendy boutique hotel. We didn't find soundproofing a problem although the heavy rock concert on our third night penetrated the balcony doors. But it was so loud I am sure you would have heard it no matter where you were staying in that area. I don't think that would stop us staying there again as the location was just brilliant. There is a restuarant in the hotel but we didn't use it. There are so many cafes around to choose from and there is also a fridge and table/chairs in the room so you can have a continental breakfast on the balcony (or in the room)if you wish. Overall it was a great way to see Barcelona and I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: hubbjay
Reviews.Content: We researched this hotel on trip advisor before booking and we were not disappointed. The hotel is beautiful it is modern with clean cut lines. The staff are fantastic nothing is too much trouble for them. We emailed prior to arriving asking for a nice room (we heard the higher up you are the better the views) for our anniversary. We got room 1008 on the 10th floor upon popping the key card into the light slot a blind on the floor to ceiling window in front us us rose up giving us breathtaking views of the square to the front. Shortly after settling in a knock on the door whereby a bell hop boy delivered us cava and strawberries dipped in chocolate courtesy of the hotel what a lovely touch. We also had a meal in the hotel and the food was excellent we had fillet steak and we thought the price was reasonable 17 euro's. Getting to and from the airport was too easy thanks again to my research on this site you just come out of the airport turn left and get on the bus a2 get off at the last stop when you get off you are in front of the square look to your left and upwards you will see the hotel. We also went on the bus tour it cost 58 euros for both of us for 2 days you can go on the red route or the blue route or both personally we preferred the blue route as this took you to more historic sites the red route seemed to just go around the industrial area . All in all fantastic stay would recommend

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Adelphi10
Reviews.Content: I visited Barcelona with my Husband over New Year to celebrate his 30th birthday. I had emailled the hotel prior to my visit to ask for a room with a view of Cataluyna Square and when we checked in, our request had been fulfilled. Staff spoke excellent English and were very helpful, offering to take our bags and giving us information and maps about the area. After checking in, we went for an explore and realised just how central the hotel was to all the key areas of interest. You can access many key areas by foot and, when your legs need a rest, there are 3 metro stations (access to different lines) in very close walking distance. We though the price of a 2 day ticket was very reasonable (10 euros I think). On returning to the room, the hotel had given a gift of water and apples to celebrate our stay which I thought was a nice touch. The room itself was very comfortable. Ultra modern, with some quirky aspects but which is fitting with a central city hotel, in our opinion. Little niggles like the bathroom layout and privacy in the loo or shower (which I had read about from other people's reviews here) could be an issue for some, but not for us. We felt this added to the character of the room and enjoyed the 'unusual-ness' of this feature. We would definitately recommend this hotel to a friend and would love to go back. Barcelona is a fantastic city - you must visit!

Reviews.Title: “Top city, top location and great room - however, noisy and expensive”
Reviews.Author: itsthatbirdagain
Reviews.Content: Lovely big room (suite deluxe) which sleeps 3 in real comfort and a terrific view right over the square (Plaza de Catalunya). However, the room was really quite noisy (street noise) and you need to take care of this. Breakfast was fine. If we stayed in Barcelona again, I would go for one of the hotels directly on the Rambla - possibly the Montecarlo. However, not many hotels offering proper size suites (40m) and certainly not many offering such a great view of the square.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for honeymooners or for just visiting Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: bigtomsky
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location! Please remember this when you plan your trip to Barcelona and take a look at this place. My wife and I were in our honeymoon here and, when I choose this hotel, I was in doubt but once we get there... It was almost perfect. You are right in the heart of Barcelona, a major transportation point (Catalunya Place), next to major touristic places, you can find quickly a place to eat or spent time if you have nothing planned etc. We booked for one week a room with view to Placa Catalunya and they gave us a room with terrace (which i think it's more expensive) with no extra charges, the staff is friendly, the room was beautiful, the bed was perfect (I'm almost 2 m high or 6'7''). It's a place where you can enjoy your vacation. If I remeber well, somebody said it's terrible they don't have a fitness room. You're in Barcelona, walk out of the hotel and you will came back exhausted in the evening. One minus we had for the hotel, we tried one evening to eat at the hotel restaurant but we had to give up. the food was terrible (either the cook was in vacation or we had the terrrible "luck" to order the only uneatable food they had). But right next to hotel you'll find at least 5 or 6 places were you can enjoy a perfect dinner and this is not a major drawback. Hope you'll find this review usefull in planning your trip to Barcelona and choosing this hotel. Last but not least, enjoy your vacation, Barcelona it's a marvelous city to visit!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel for a fantastic honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: GoBlau
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at his hotel for one week for our honeymoon, and we absolutely loved it. It was my second time in Barcelona, so I had a good idea of where I wanted us to stay. First of all, getting there from the El Prat airport was almost too easy: just ask where you can take the bus that takes you right to Plaça Catalunya. I believe the ride was 5 euros a person, so have some cash ready. A short while later we were getting off the bus and crossing the street to our hotel. Upon walking in we were greeted by only smiles and polite people. The bellhop helped us with our luggage to the room and gave us a little tour. We were on the 8th floor with views to the courtyard. I was hoping for street views, but I was actually very well pleased with the views that we got over the city roofs to the beach. I can't say how happy we were with the workers at the hotel with one exception (I'll get to that). To give some examples, we brought cava back to the hotel to drink in the courtyard which I then spilled all over the place; the bartender heard and rushed with towels to clean it up and extra ones for us. Also, the bellhop who was patient enough to let me practice my Catalan with him and give us the 411 on attending the Camp Nou for a match (I got tips on that too, if you want them). Everybody tried their best to answer our questions and were very helpful. My only complaint was that the cleaning ladies could get pretty loud outside our room when we wanted to sleep in. That only happened a couple times, though. As far as the room goes, we were very pleased with it. We got a triple, which included a sofa-bed that we sometimes used to watch tv. It was all very clean and neat. The layout of the room was unique and had a very efficient use of space. We loved the shower, although you can't leave the door open with the shower head running, or it could spill out of the shower. No bath tub, but we didn't miss it. There were some imperfections with the construction of the room, but you had to look pretty closely to find them, and they didn't really affect us at all. I will say that the lights took some practice to figure out what each button did. I did love, however, that I could raise the blinds with the push of a button in the morning without getting out of bed. One thing that did bug us, however, was the wifi connection which was very weak. They should do something about that. As far as the location goes, well you really can't beat it as a tourist. Las Ramblas is literally around the corner and Passeig de Gracia is across the plaza; those two streets have very different feels, so each night we could easily decide which feel we wanted for our dinner. The buses and metro are also so close that you'll feel spoiled. If you want to do some grocery shopping to save on meals, go to the bottom level of El Corte Ingles, which is also on the plaza, and eat on the plaza or take it back to the nice lounge in the hotel on the 2nd level. And for the Americans that get really homesick, there's a Burger King and a McDonalds also on the plaza. We found it perfect for grabbing something before heading to Barça match. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, and would definitely love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Walkers-Wombourne
Reviews.Content: Olivia Plaza is a lovely modern hotel in an excellent central location. The location does not get much better with great views (we had a room on the 10th floor overlooking Catalunya square) & easy access to public transport (the airport bus, underground & city sightseeing buses stopped across the square). Barcelona is a great city for sight seeing with plenty to see & do with lots of good places to eat, drink & shop. As in any city eating & drinking within the main tourist trap areas ie the Ramblas can be pricey but we found plenty of places just off the main areas which served good quality food at sensible prices. Would fully recommend the Olivia Plaza as a good clean modern base to stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: WGfamilyontour
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 2 nights at the Olivia Palace. The location was great for the metro buses, shopping and general sightseeing. A large number of rooms ( from 11 to 14 on each floor) look out over the inner courtyard which is contained under a glass roof, with the bar and reception being on the lower floor. These standard rooms had no access to fresh air, when opening the windows and the nosie from below would echo. The A/C was very good and quite. Our room (14) had a small window and looked out on to a corridor and there was very little natural light. There is a roof terrace giving a good view of the city. Breakfast was expensive at €20 per head, there is a cafe at the front of the hotel selling coffee and pastries. Free internet available too.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pgib64
Reviews.Content: Perfect location...off airport bus at Plaza Catalunya and cross the road. We celebrated my wifes' birthday during our stay..I requested cava and flowers (like you do!), reception staff were extremely courteous & helpful with a nice birthday greeting and strawberries dipped in chocolate....a perfect start to the holiday. The hotel room had a great view of Plaza Catualunya, and if you looked the other way you had a view of the glass walled shower...a bit wasted on ourselves as we are a little bit the wrong side of 65! Open plan bathrooms look great, but not sure on praticalities. Breakfast was good, with most tastes catered for.Nice bread... good coffee... hot food (eggs, sausage, ham) if that's your thing, and you could eat between 7 - 11am. Didn't get chance to sample dinner...too many good places around! Thanks to all at the Olivia Plaza for helping to make it a memorable visit.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel at perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Zanziluel
Reviews.Content: We got a spacious room facing Plaza Catalunia. Very trendy interior that suited us fine. The breakfast was perfect in we had ours outside in the small garden on a glassfloor.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: morgey
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Olivia Plaza hotel for 2 nights prior to our cruise departure. Like previous reviews, the location is fantastic. We took the Aerobus from the airport to Placa Catayluna and the hotel was just a very short walk away. There is easy access to taxis, double-decker buses, las Ramblas, etc. We enjoyed the modern look of the rooms. The open style bathrooms may not be for everyone. We did not eat at the restaurant . The staff spoke Engligh and were very helpfull. The airlines had lost 1 of our bags and the hotel staff took care of arranging the delivery of our bag to the hotel for us.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant for a Weekend”
Reviews.Author: GN&CB
Reviews.Content: We visited Barcelona last weekend with another couple and had a brilliant time. Olivia Plaza is really well located to reach all the most popular parts of town, and we were very pleasantly surprised by the quality of the hotel itself. The design is very modern and stylish, with lots of glass. Particularly the outside terrace area which has been squeezed into a tiny space, but is a wonderful oasis in a busy city. Our room had a fantastic view over the main square. The windows are full height and do not open, and this means that noise is mimimal. However, our friends had a room with a view of the lift, which wasnt so much fun. The view made all the difference to me, so be sure to avoid the 'internal' rooms. We ate lunch at the hotel a couple of times, and the food and wine selection/quality were good. We found the service rather slow. Everyone was very friendly and helpful, but it was usual to wait 15 minutes for a drink. It wasnt too much of a problem, and the hotel was pretty busy. A nearby restaurant not to be missed is Les Caracoles (The Snails), Escudellers - just off La Rambla. Open since 1835, you have to walk through the kitchen to reach your table ! Impossible to get a booking, so you have to just turn up and wait for a table. A real novelty, and the sangria is leathal! A great city to spend the weekend in autumn, as the temperature was around 26 degrees, and you didnt need a jacket out in the evenings. This hotel was a good central bases to explore from and relax at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in great location!”
Reviews.Author: pstar11
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect - on the Plaza Catalunya at the top of the Ramblas. All the buses - airport and tourist - stop here, and there are subway stops too. The hotel is gorgeous - all modernist and yet comfortable. We paid a bit extra for an upgrade so that we would have a good view onto the plaza and also so that we had the enclosed bathroom which was great - big soaker tub, separate shower stall with rain shower - lovely! There is a great coffee bar next door, and in the opposite direction a Hard Rock Cafe. Great eats at both, and at the Pizza Marzano at the top of the Ramblas. The front desk staff were great especially when my husband's wallet was stolen on the Ramblas. Leave your wallet in the hotel safe and take just the cash you can afford to lose. Other than the pickpocket, we had a great time in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel,Great Location,Great city”
Reviews.Author: Armin_9
Reviews.Content: we have stayed there for 8 nights in suite deluxe and that was fantastic,the suite was very clean & modern decorated ,the staff was so helpful specially Sivlia,but i think the other people in reception could be more friendly that they were(if they want to consider them perfect but they were ok!).Location was great ,near to everywhere you wanna see,we aksed reseption for renting bikes & there was bike rental near & that was great experience for us to riding the bike all over the city,breakfast was great but expensive you can find many places for breakfast near by the hotel with half price of the hotel.the internet connection was good & I suggest to people that if there are 3 or more choose suite that is more comfortable than the standard room with extra bed. we enjoy our stay there & if I want to go Barcelona again Im sure that I will choose Olivia plaza again ,

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Meanster
Reviews.Content: I have very high expectations as I work in the Tourism Industry and Im used to staying in top hotels and on a regular bases. We really enjoyed our 4 day mid week stay at this hotel as the location was excellent. You get the Aerobus from the airport to Placa Catalunya and the hotel is on Placa Catalunya so you have a 30 second walk across the round and you are there. Hassle free. If you stay in this hotel you are in the thick of the action at the top of the ramblas. First impressions were great as the reception area is slick and the staff were very efficient. After reading other reviews we requested a room on one of the upper floors and with a view of the square, we got a room on the 8th floor which an excellent view of the a square. We paid £474 for four nights room only. A bit more than we had planned on spending but its was well worth it. We booked it through Tripadvisor. Things I loved about the room Floor to ceiling window with amazing view and total black out blinds The Colour Scheme The Open plan bath room. This might not suit everyone. Its unusual for a hotel bedroom so I quite like it. The Massive Double Bed. Its hard to get double beds in Spain as they usually do two singles. The Breakfast was nice and sitting on the terrance is very pleasant but at €19 we found it too expensive so we only did it one morning. Although it you dont do bfast in the hotels in Spain its hard get a good bfast anywhere else as they Spanish dont really do bfast its mainly coffee and pastry. 2 PCs with free internet access Highlights of our Trip Fat Tire Bike Tours - Check it out as an alternative to the Bus Tour, great way to see the city. 4 hour tour €20 each.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong. Best hotel in the Best Location.”
Reviews.Author: Cueball123
Reviews.Content: Dont stay anywhere else. Pros: right in the middle of Plaza Catalunya-- a huge hub of action--food-- people--shopping. 2 minute walk to the Ramblas-- close to the best shopping areas in town, markets, restaurants. Close to subways that go to the beach or other parts of town. Everything is walkable. The hotel itself is ultra-modern but not obnoxious. Rooms are clean with great views of the city. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: AthensBoy
Reviews.Content: This has got to be the best value for the money in Barcelona! And what a GREAT location in Plaza Catalunya! Great food, service, location. It has its own charm and unique modern ambiance - very comfortable. It was a nice place to call home for a week. Neat outdoor eating area for breakfast and internet center available on second floor for those of us who don't like carrying laptops when we travel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at Hotel Olivia!”
Reviews.Author: meganhb
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel and it was a very central location. The Aerobus to and from the airport is just across the street and is only 5 Euros per person. And the Hop On, Hop off Bus is also right across the street. The rooms were nice and the beds were comfortable. The shower was very nice too! The hotel staff was always pleasant and helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, cosy and funky”
Reviews.Author: FatcatJunketeer
Reviews.Content: Situated on a sidestreet to the Ramblas, the hotel is right in the middle of the action without being right on the busy and arguably dodgy street. The metro is across the road and taxis and buses are right at your doorstep. Theres a Carefour express 5 mins away and shopping and food outlets all round. Arguably the best location in the city unless you want to be near the marina. The hotel and room decor is very modern, with basic ikea type furniture - functional but "cheap". Everything was spotless and in good condition. Rooms are a reasonable size with a small tv, free wifi and open-plan bathroom with little privacy. No pool or gym but there's also a lounge downstairs complete with big screen tv and a couple of PCs with internet for guests, which is a really nice touch. Get a room at the front for a great view of the square out front (although they can be noisy), as the rooms at the back have no view and you will have to keep the blinds closed since some of the windows face the lifts. You wont be sleeping early anyhow, the city is buzzing at midnight. Rooms dont have door latches so watch out for housekeeping bursting in at 8am despite your do not disturb signs. Walls are pretty thin and the a/c turns off if you take your key out of the power socket which is annoying (but the blinds go down automatically which is great). Breakfast although expensive was pretty good, great quality, decent variety and very tasty - much better than some of the choices in the vicinity. Room service however was a let down. Service was reasonable, some are friendly with a couple of grumpy ones. Overall a comfy, funky and cosy albeit noisy place to stay. Not great value but reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, creative design, very hip & stylish. Great food!”
Reviews.Author: Syreen
Reviews.Content: It is right in the center, where someone can shop and drop off what they bought at the hotel if things got heavy! Right next to the La Rambla famous street. Metro, bus station, malls, shops, restaurants, pharmacies, sightseeing tours are all accessible as in 100 meters away! The hotel itself is very stylish, free internet. Clean bathrooms. Good service. The breakfast area is just so relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously best location.”
Reviews.Author: angela369
Reviews.Content: I can't really add much to what already been said - great, modern rooms with a fantastic location at the end of Las Ramblas. Seriously just around the corner yet away from the noise. Staff weren't quite as friendly as others have said but I didn't ask for much either. Only word of warning (and why the room rating only got a 'good' ) is because our room had a big, fat, POST right in front of the sink/counter in the bathroom! Seriously, it was really in the way but I noticed from the floor plan that it is only one room on each floor (sorry, I can't remember our room # but make sure you specify you don't want that room!). Restaurant is lovely as well. No parking so you will be $30 Euros per day in the public park. We even tried driving a ways away to park but they are all the same price.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Alcron
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff could not be more helpful, arrived early in morning and our room was ready. Unfortunately I had asked for a view which put us on the Plaza side and in summer this is very hot - the airconditing will not go below 20 (which is think is government requirement) So if you like a cool room this is not for you, it was hot day and night. The location is fantastic, to bus , metro everything. Tv has numerous channels but only BBC and CNN in English. There is no tea or coffee making in room and no where to hang your towels to dry. This side of the hotel would be fine in winter otherwise ask for back of hotel. Breakfast not included and expensive, plenty of places to eat outside. Go away from the tourist area to get a reallt good meal and tapas.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but rooms don’t offer a lot of privacy”
Reviews.Author: AbbyToronto
Reviews.Content: The best part about this hotel was the location. It is right at the heart of the city in Placa Catalunya. We took several tours offered by Turisme de Barcelona and they all left right from the Placa. The airport bus drops you off right in front of your hotel and there is a metro station there as well. There are also numerous great restaurants and tapas bars that are a short walk, or short taxi or metro ride from the hotel. As for the hotel itself, we found it “interesting.” Checking-in was a bit rough. It took about 45 minutes. When we did get our room, we realized that the walls were paper thin. We mentioned this to the receptionist and we were promptly moved to another room on the 8th floor facing Placa Catalunya. We did get some noise from the street during the day, but it was pretty quiet at night. The room was very modern. In my opinion, somewhat unnecessarily modern. You open the door and you are right in the washroom. There is only a semi-transparent sliding door separating the toilet and shower from the rest of the room. Not a lot of privacy. But the room was definitely nice and clean and the bed was comfortable. All-in, a good 4* hotel in a great location. However, if I could find something of the same class and price range, in the same location, but with a bit of a more traditional room layout, I would prefer that.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favourite hotels ever”
Reviews.Author: Westkirby
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect hotel for couples. If you can get a room with a balcony, your experience of Barcelona will be amazing, particularly if it's your first time. We have been to Barcelona twice and stayed here both times - the second time, we actually checked out of our first hotel so we could check into the Olivia Plaza. I wouldn't recommend this for families, but it is ideal for couples. The restaurant and bar are fantastic and it is often strange to think how close to the busy city centre you are when you are out on the beautiful terrace. Strongly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “not a good choice for families or friends--ok for couples”
Reviews.Author: wdr5
Reviews.Content: This was a beautiful hotel but not what we hoped it was. We stayed one night before leaving on a cruise. We had 2 rooms. One room w/ 3 adults and 1 room w/ 2 adults and teen. They first tried to give us a fold out --which we refused for the 3 adult room--we wanted 3 beds. Then they acted like it was our fault for not specifying 3 beds when we felt like the description of the room was misleading when we booked it. There is virtually no privacy when using the restroom or taking showers! Everything is glass. You cannot even get dressed in privacy. Very poorly laid out room. Lighting also very poor. For the expense you would expect at least a coffee maker! We thought are rooms came w/ breakfast based on the reviews but we did not get breakfast unless we wanted to pay 25E each! We also did not like the attitude of the staff. The only great thing about the hotel is the location. It is close to everything. We were glad that we did not book this hotel for the return night before departing.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary, Boutique Hotel in La Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: REDRUBY711
Reviews.Content: The Olivia Hotel is a small but impressive, contemporary, boutique hotel conveniently situated by La Ramblas. The metro is a 3 to 5 minute walk away. You are greeted by a pleasant and helpful hotel staff. My husband and my room was located on the fourth floor and had a fantastic view of the city and park area. The room itself was designed with contempory furnishings. I loved the color scheme was decorated in browns and grays and accented with contrasting colors of red and olive green. I loved the contemporary bathroom and vanity area. If you are the shy type or traveling with family, you may not appreciate the frosted shower glass partition that separates the actual shower from the sleeping area. I also appreciated that the room was very clean. I really like that Olivia Hotel was within walking distance or a metro away from most sites. I must take the time to walk to La Boqueria. My husband and I had breakfast there every morning. There is so much food to choose from it was a challenge trying to decide where we were going to eat. El Cortes market is also directly across the street from the Oliva Hotel. You can shop for food, clothing, souvenirs and miscellaneous necessities you may have forgotten at home all under one roof. For dinner, my husband and I had a variety of restaurants to choose from (again walking distance from the hotel). I would strongly recommend the Olivia Hotel to a fellow travel.

Reviews.Title: “in the middle of the city”
Reviews.Author: vondels
Reviews.Content: Clean, modern, boutique hotel with friendly staff. Buffet breakfast was delicious in the small breakfast area. Sweets near the lift. Tv had all the senders, incl. CNN. Free use of the hotel computer and newspaper in the business center. In the middle of all the happenings, you can walk to all the sightseeings. We had 2 rooms, one lays in a quieter room than the other one, this one was very noisy, you can hear the people talking next door and the noise outside.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL HOTEL, Great Staff, Great location!”
Reviews.Author: mssee
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room #1010, front of hotel. I am an extremely light sleeper, heard no noise from the street below. The view was spectacular, the square below, the mountains, just beautiful. My son & daughter-in-law stood in room # 302 facing the back, which had a view of the harbor & church. Large rooms. Helpful staff, they made our dinner reservations. Just a wonderful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Helpful reception staff who made a weary traveller very happy!”
Reviews.Author: megajudas
Reviews.Content: I attended the Olivia Plaza hotel for the 3gsm conference. The hotel is located in the heart of Barcelona, near the central station Catalunya. I flew in and caught the train to Passeig de Gracias and then it’s easier to take a taxi or walk to Catalunya than go to Sants station. On arriving at the x hotel, the reception was clean and a bright eyed French receptionist greeted me and took my reservation. I was given an interior facing room, spacious and fully and stylishly furnished. However I was in and out of meetings at the conference and had to work during the day from my room. Although the rooms are adequacy lit, I preferred some more natural light. Most people stay in the rooms during the night only... So I asked down at reception and was fortunate to ask after check out time about room allocations. Rebecca again quickly looked up for a room change and suggested some rooms on different floors. Luckily there was space and I was moved. I think maybe business reservations are moved to the interior to keep noise from the street down, which is sensible really. Having gone to other cities a bad night can kill any chance of feeling awake during a 4 hour next day meeting. The hotel is located near to bars, restaurants and central shopping areas. Most of which are totally touristy. I took a look around and didn't find anything. Café Zurich is nice, but the serving staff there is a bit curt. I went back to the hotel and Rebecca, who knew me quite well by then, told me what the hotel was serving for lunch. So I ate at the hotel restaurant. Portions were good, food healthy and service good. I will definitely recommend the Hotel Olivia Plaza Barcelona to all my friends and work colleagues who’ll be there next time from the United States. A big thank you to Rebecca and to the Hotel Management! If I’m lucky to go again to the conference, I’m gonna have a word with the travel dept to get me here, my work mates weren’t so lucky!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy rooms on front of building”
Reviews.Author: mrsbirdo
Reviews.Content: Having been to Barcelona over 20 times I was keen to stay at this hotel. I booked a suite and was very disappointed by the lack of sound proofing - as the location is very central on Plaza Catalunya there is constant traffic noise. The noise affected my husband and I so much that we had to move hotels. The front desk commented that nobody else had complained about the noise so I surmise that light sleepers beware!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern Hotel in an excellent central location”
Reviews.Author: Wisc33
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Olivia Plaza as part of a Hen weekend and was extremely pleased with the Hen's choice. It was a very clean, modern hotel which is perfectly positioned in the centre of Barcelona and within walking distance to the main tourist areas and shops. The only negative we found was the cost for breakfast which was over 20 euros a person - too much in our opinion. Having said that Barcelona isn't a cheap city to visit. Make sure you take plenty of euros with you - you'll need it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: dscottmsw
Reviews.Content: Having travelled to numerous European "hot spots", we have become quity picky about where we stay! This hotel is very convenient and rooms quite large (for europe standards). As we've found most hotel beds in Europe to be quite firm...we were pleased to find this hotel's bed was quite comfy (not soft...but not rock hard either). Plus: Size of room and location Negatives: No real privacy for the bathrooms, price of room, and lack of wi-fi internet. Yes, the hotel says it has wi-fi but you have to "sign up" for it and then you only get like an hour or so...when we used one of the two computers available to guests - the computers repeatedly froze.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: MaryReading
Reviews.Content: Seven of us(all women) stayed at the Olivia Plaza for two nights on a trip to celebrate a 50th birthday. I emailed prior to arrival to confirm our request for two twins and one triple room close together with outside views and on mid to top floors. All these requests were met and throughout the weekend the staff were very helpful, friendly and obliging. The beds were comfortable and the layout of the rooms suited us, particularly the bathroom as the shower, toilet and sink could all be used independently. You just have to remember to pull the screen doors in the right direction!!. The location is great as the airport bus and tour bus stop nearby and it is walking distance to all the central sights. We had heard that pick pockets could be a problem so we all took precautions and and had no difficulties. In fact we never felt threatened on the streets day or evening. A great city as there is so much to see and do.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: yatraman
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, central location all the buses to the clubs leave from the hotel, its clean, its modern, great showers, view from certain hotels might not be great but its Barcelona and its crowded and this is a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: DBAToronto
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Olivia Plaza in Oct–Nov 2008 for a combination business trip/family holiday. We were a bit nervous, since the hotel was not reviewed in any travel guides, but the favourable reviews here led us to make a booking. We were not disappointed! We stayed in a family suite on the 9th floor. The room was fairly large by European standards, although the bathroom was cramped, but we had a spectacular view from the balcony across Plaça Catalunya, right out in front. The room itself was very hip with great modern design. A sliding glass door separated the bedroom from the living room with a sofa bed, so our son could go to sleep and we could stay up to read or watch TV. The bathroom facilities and amenities were excellent. The rooms were quite soundproofed, except when the neighbours stepped out onto their adjacent balcony. The service was excellent.
