All of the hotel staff were very accommodating and friendly, and treated us (especially our 2-year old) extremely well. They were very helpful with nearby restaurant recommendations. The location of the hotel can't be beat: right in the centre of town, between the Gothic Quarter and the Eixample. A metro station is a few steps away and even the waterfront is only 20 minutes' walk. The El Corte Inglés department store is next door, so getting snacks and groceries was very easy. We only tried the restaurant for the breakfast buffet, which was very good. They had a high chair. There are also two free Internet terminals in the Mezzanine.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely NOT a Four Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrooklynRoxie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Olivia Plaza hotel from November 29, through December 2, 2008 after coming off a 14 day cruise. Let me start with the good: This hotel is located centrally along Placa Catalunya. This is an excellent location for getting around Barcelona; and is around the corner from Las Ramblas. The hotel is located across the street from the beginning of the Hop On Hop Off bus routes. The Tourist Information Center is also located across from this hotel, underground. Olivia Hotel offers a wonderful buffet breakfast with a wide array of breakfast food. The cost of the breakfast is 20 Euros. The NOT so good: When my travel companion and I arrived we were assigned to room 701. We left the hotel for about half hour and upon our return we found our room flooded. It appeared that the flood was caused by water seeping up from the floor. When the hotel was advised of this their response was very laissez faire. When we booked the room we requested a room with 2 separate beds. We were informed that if we wanted another room with 2 separate beds, we would be reassigned to room 301; or we could have room 702, next door, without separate beds. These were the two options given to us to correct this situation. When we went to room 301, the stench coming from this room was overwhelming; it smelled like raw sewage. The hotel is aware of this condition, however, as stated previously -laissez faire. This was unacceptable to us as a result we took room 702. Each evening for approximately an hour the stench that we smelled in room 301 would envelop our room then go away. The way the rooms are set up does not lend itself to privacy. The sink, toilet and shower are really part of the greater room. There is a recessed mirrored partition that you can pull out of the recess to block the sink from the sleeping area. This offers a modicum of privacy while bathing, toileting, etc. The toilet and shower are along the same wall and share a sliding glass door. If you pull the glass door one way it covers the toilet. Pull the other way and it covers the shower. Due to the layout of the toilet, there isn’t a sufficient barrier between the sound and odors (sorry, no delicate way of putting this) of the bathroom and the sleeping area. Lastly, luke cold water from the shower. The water from the sink is hot but the water in the shower is not. When we asked about this their response was “this is hot.” Again, remember laissez faire. I wore a hat the entire time I was in Barcelona because the water in the shower was too cold to wash my hair; and my head could not fit under the sink facet. I hope this review is helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Titcher
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel, we had to change hotels to this one. Read on to find out why! We arrived at the H10 hotel across from the Olivia at 12.30pm and the reception looked nice small but nice. We went up to the room to discover it was more like a wardrobe than a bedroom. The room was so small and had the smallest double bed I have ever seen. The bathroom was tiny, it was really just an excuse for a bathroom. The window looked out onto a brick wall. I just could not stay in the room, you could only access the bed from one side. We went back down to reception to complain and see if there were any bigger rooms. She sent us up to look at a twin room, the only differences were two single beds in the room and the window gave more light. We just could not stay here for the weekend. I had looked up the hotel Olivia when searching and it was also in Placa Catalunya, its a four star hotel and the rooms were massive and very modern. We had to pay one nights accommodation as a cancellation fee to the H10 but it was worth it to get out of there. short walk across the placa and we were in hotel Olivia in a fab room and full length window looking onto the Placa. Would highly recommend this hotel and the staff, worth paying that little bit extra.

Reviews.Title: “A great find in a wonderful position”
Reviews.Author: LondonNaomi
Reviews.Content: We took advice from the reviews on Trip Advisor to book this hotel and it was well worth it. The hotel is in a great position - right in the hub of the city and nearby everything including the tourist bus stop. Very helpful staff and a lovely modern, clean environment with a delightful outdoor seating area. Plentiful breakfast (bar closes at midnight). The only things that travellers should be aware of are the internal rooms - we specifically requested a double bed and no internal room and were presented with a twin internal room. This was soon overcome and we would recommend travellers should reconfirm things with the hotel in advance to make sure they dont have problems. Well worth a visit to both the Hotel and the city! Weather was wonderful too - warm sunshine whilst it poured with rain at home.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: brightnewbride
Reviews.Content: After a long honeymoon cruise round the mediterranean sea, my husband and me were only thinking about a well deserved rest sipping some cold drinks and relaxing in Barcelona before going back to reality in the UK. We were longing for nothing but a king size bed to lay back and enjoy our last night. Guess what happened? Irene at the Front Desk! She was so encouraging and pleased to help that we end up spending that last day getting to see a bit more of Barcelona, which was, to be honest, the best suggestion ever! And we went back to our room late in the evening only to find out a bottle of the local champagne and a couple of glasses, along with a congratulation card for our wedding ...the icing on the cake! Not to talk about the modern, beautiful and comfortable room and the smiling staff at the breakfast service. Highly recommendable for shortbreaks or couples, will come back for our first anniversary as Irene wisely suggested, if not before with some friends, but you will definetely see more of us! Only two things: not everyone at the front desk is that friendly and the hot water shower in the morning run cold after a while.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: LuciaSouthYorkshire
Reviews.Content: This was a fantastic hotel for our 4 night stay in Barcelona. It was extremely well located for the Metro and Hard Rock Cafe! My husband and I had taken our 3 year 11 month old daughter with us, therefore requiring a triple room. The hotel room was not the largest we have ever stayed in (once the sofa bed was made up for Siena), but the space was more than adequate. The hotel was extremely clean and modern, all staff were very friendly and helpful. The only negative thing we could say about this hotel is that following a few days of extremely heavy rain, the shower didn't drain well - but this was consistant with the rest of the city judging by the overflowing drains in the streets. We would definitely recommend this hotel as it is very customer and child friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Central Olivia Plaza”
Reviews.Author: isolander
Reviews.Content: This is a very clean and modern hotel set in the most central spot of Barcelona. The rooms are open plan and uncluttered and very quiet. For two people the closet space was limited and the bathroom almost a little too open plan! But enjoyed the very quiet back terrace away from the noise and chaos of the city. Access to the airport bus, metro and attractions excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as it could be”
Reviews.Author: WW_view
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, last stop on the airport bus into town and then cross the road and you're there. Reception was very friendly (Irene) although the first indication of what was to come appeared when she was unable to contact anyone from housekeeping to find out if the room was ready. The rooms look great but are fairly impractical, one single sliding door for shower and toilet may seem like an original design but is just plain annoying. The wash hand basin is positioned just inside the door, there is no bathroom as such, and the whole entrance area gets wet with even the slightest usage. The beds are strangely uncomfortable but I couldn't figure out what was really wrong despite waking up several time to try to find out. The lighting is irritating in that most of the switches seem to bathe the room in virtual daylight. There didn't seem to be the possibility to have just enough light to get to the toilet for example. The hotel wasn't noisy but I could clearly hear conversations from other rooms (I'm sure I could have joined in!). There was no water one night and a call to reception provided no indication as to how long the situation would last or even the slightest apology for the inconvenience. Housekeeping was quite random, towels left in the shower, as instructed, to be changed were exactly as we had left them upon our return. Other supplies were not replenished. Breakfast was OK but the coffee shop next door provided all we needed considerably more cheaply. The location is truly fantastic and for that alone it was nearly worth it but the hotel is not the cheapest and the standard of housekeeping means I would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: GraceDanielle
Reviews.Content: Excellent location right on the square where the tour buses begin. Just round the corner to Las Ramblas and about 10 -15 minute walk to marina and beach. Hotel was very modern, clean and staff very friendly. Breakfast buffet style but everything you could want and displayed really well. only draw back the sound proof in rooms could be bettere but hey if you're a night owl it won't affect you! It was only because we'd been out all day and exhausted that when our neighbours came in at 3 am we heard them. Strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “That 'home away from home' feeling.”
Reviews.Author: Khalil8
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant two-nights stay - particularly that we received an upgrade to a suite. Only things to criticise were: a) The suite was serviced late in the morning ... it was not cleaned before about two o'clock in the afternoon on the second day. b) The toilet does not contain a 'bidet'. However, these are very small inconveniences when balanced against the major conveniences like 'location', 'friendliness of staff'', and the general atmosphere of being 'at home'. We will certainly stay there again when next in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Olivia is a tourist Trap, dirtyand has Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: calem88
Reviews.Content: There was such a tiny room, and not what I reservered, and they never changed the linens once. the bathroom was dirty, and the service was horrible. ANoisy and mean spirited front desk. I am telling all my friends to avoid this one. Location is great. But way overpriced for the dirt and noise.

Reviews.Title: “A little Gem in Cataluña Square (Perfect Location for seeing Barcelona)”
Reviews.Author: MurphyDubai
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Olivia Plaza for 2 nights in October 08. We were on a short break from Dubai and after visiting friends & family in the UK. We decided at the last minute to take a short break in Barcelona and wanted to be close to the action. I spent a little time on the internet and looked up hotels near “Las Ramblas”. Coming from the Middle East we are used to height standards of service in hotels. From the minute we checked in we were not disappointed with the levels of attention given by the friendly and helpful staff. The rooms were very modern with all the trimming and lovely bathrooms. (You could have been forgiven for thinking it was only a 4*) The view was amazing from our room overlooking Cataluña Square where you are able to catch the blue & red line tourist buses. You are a few steps from walking down the famous Las Ramblas where you really can feel the vibrant night life. If you were looking for a late night cap I could recommend a friendly bar 2 min’s walk down Las Ramblas on the left called “Temple Bar”. I would especially like to say a thank you to Rebecca who was extremely helpful on reception at helping us out with information. We enjoyed Barcelona so much we wished we had spent more time there, but when we return this is the only place we will be staying. Perfect location, fantastic service and a staff that really know how to make their guests feel welcome.10/10!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel could ask for More”
Reviews.Author: ChrisRicho1989
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in feb this year and i could have wish for a better hotel! Before here i was in manchester in the hilton and this hotel was better! If or when i go back to barcelona i would go back here, the location is amazing, you are so close to everywhere that you need to be. Good work hotel managers!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Vacation in Olivia Plaza”
Reviews.Author: Seniorita37
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend in Barcelona. The hotel was located in the center of Barcelona in Catalunia square. The rooms were great and very well equipited and the service was excellent, super friendly and efficient. We can not wait to come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Olivia Plaza”
Reviews.Author: Explorer09
Reviews.Content: The Olivia Plaza is a great place to stay when in Barcelona. We found its central location extremely convenient allowing our short stay in the city to be enjoyed to the fullest with minimum time wasted on travelling. The airport bus stops across the square from the hotel, the metro (underground) is metres away, as is the Ramblas. In fact, we walked from the hotel to many popular attractions in the city. As far as the hotel itself goes, the rooms are tip-top: stylish and comfortable. The staff were very friendly and always ready to assist - they even took it upon themselves to arrange that some of our luggage that got lost on the flight to Barcelona was followed up and delivered while we were away touring the streets! I hope to return soon!

Reviews.Title: “great 1st time visit to Barcelona - perfect choice of hotel”
Reviews.Author: Littlejohn
Reviews.Content: stayed here over the weekend - a treat from my lovely husband for our 1st wedding anniversary. The location was great - central to shops, transport and sights. take 1/2 a day and get round the city on the Bus Touristic - see all the sights in one go and make up your mind where to go back too. (Tip - dont queue in Catalunia square for the bus - you'll be there for hours!!!! Simply turn left out of the hotel and take the 2nd street of the square - the one after Ramblas). Walk down to where the street splits and jump on the bus there. No line and you can buy your tickets on board). Hotel staff were mainly great (front desk team very good - great restaurant recomendations). Breakfast staff less accommodating - seemed to prefer Spaniards! Some great restaruants here - Comerc24 was amazing. Also El Nou Ramonet - amazing baby squid and fab wines. The hotel offers good value, lovely accommodation and a great central location. Towels a bit lacking in size, quality and thickness were my only room complaint (except no irons available - staff would iron for you - at a cost). I just went slightly crumpled! Save 20Euro per couple and jump on the bus from the Airport - every 8 mins, to directly outside the hotel. Went with Flyglobespan - one of the few direct form Edinburgh - nightmare! They moved both Glasgow and Edinburgh flights to return at 3am instead of 3pm!!! What's that all about - just for their own unexplained operational reasons!!!! I know that's the last time I'll travel with them! Really enjoyed Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: dreyfus111
Reviews.Content: Olivia Plaza is a very nice design hotel with a perfect location: right on Plaça de Catalunya. We were upgraded to a suite and it was beautiful, clean and cool. The only downside is the noice from the street. The first night there was some kind of party going on. This made no difference to us, since we have no problem falling asleep but others might have a problem with it. The breakfast buffet was also very good. With a selection of different Spanish ham, cheese and sausages, it almost felt like a tapas buffet. We paid 200 Euros per night and got good value for our money. We will definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “great location.....”
Reviews.Author: unknown524
Reviews.Content: me and my husband stayed at the olivia plaza hotel for a long weekend. the hotel location is great.... its just few steps away from Las Ramblas and all the major shopping streets..the decor its very modern, the rooms are good size and nicely decorated (loved the lamps). The staff was really helpful and friendly. we were given a room on the 1st floor looking at the back of the hotel, we've asked to move to one of the top floors the next day we were at the 7th floor, still looking at the back of the hotel but we didnt mind at all. we didnt eat at the hotel, there were so many places outside. we've tried everything from traditional tapas to big burgers at the hard rock cafe. to eat las ramblas is expensive, especially for tapas, our advice is to go back streets and find where locals go to. the transports are great from the hotel, there are local buses, underground and trains. you can buy daily, 2days, 3days or 5 days travel card. 2days is 10euros. You can olsa purchase single tickets at 1.30euros, or buy 10 tickets (dont know how much). From the airport you can catch aerobus 4.80euros, straight to plaza de catalunya and drops you off literally at the door steps of the hotel. on the way back to airport we've used our daily travelcard which covers the train to the airport, that was a great value. overall we loved the hotel, the location and will highly recommend the hotel to all our friends and families.

Reviews.Title: “coldplay visit”
Reviews.Author: Oonaghb27
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Olivia Plaza hotel when we went to Barcelona for Coldplay concert. This was my fourth time in Barcelona and the Olivia Plaza was by far the nicest hotel i have stayed in so far there. I booked a double room but when we went to the room it was twin beds. We asked to be changed and this was done with no problem. The room was decorated in modern style with open plan bathroom, which might sound weird but actually worked very well. We didn't eat in the hotel as there are so many cafes etc closeby. Would definitely stay there again, location is so central and staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel!! - Great location”
Reviews.Author: PeterTBennett
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife and two children ( 3 years and 11 months old). I booked a suite and stayed for 4 nights. The hotel location is great and we could walk everywhere. The staff were extremely polite and very welcoming. We were obviously a little concerned about the hotel and children but they were great! Our children were made to feel at home and every time we sat on the terrace for a drink they brought out cakes etc for them to eat. The room is very modern but still comfortable and well laid out. For the money (roughly £1000 for the 4 nights) I thought it was very good value and would certainly go back. We asked the staff where to go and what they recommended and the restaurants and sites to see were great and we quickly trusted their judgement. All in all a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Xcellent Location, Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pinkruby
Reviews.Content: Me, my husband and our 4 yrs old daughter just came back from a fantastic holiday in Olivia plaza Hotel. The location is Xcellent, just few steps away from Las Ramblas and all the major shopping streets. The airport buss drops you off literally at the door steps of the hotel........Plaza Cataluniya is superb and lively, my daughter loved feeding the pigeons.If you are after big meals than go for the Hard Rock Cafe, its next door to the Hotel and its brilliant! There is a Gellato ice cream parlour 'Farggi' just beneath the hotel.... its gr8! The hotel itself is quite modern, the rooms are good size and nicely decorated, the bed was really comfy.....we had a triple room with large sofa bed for our daughter. I simply loved the shower, very powerful.....never had any issues regarding noice. The staff was really helpful . Breakfast was good, with loads of selection from breads to meats and cheese. The only issue we had was the internet. It was wayyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyy too slow 9 Mbps, which is ridiculous. So if you are looking to surf net in your hotel room, JUST 4GET IT! Overall we are very pleased with our hotel choice and would recommend it over and over again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to explore Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: TravlFam
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Olivia Plaza for one night after our cruise. We arrived early and they stored our luggage as we explored the city on foot. We went to MACBA and returned to check in. They upgraded us to a suite which was quite amazing. It consisted of an entrance to the right was a magnificent bathroom with a large Jacuzzi bath, a shower with the largest rain style showerhead we've seen. The shower and the toilet had separate smoked glass doors for privacy. To the left there was the living room and after that the bedroom which looked out to the Placa Catalunya. The window was floor to ceiling with both sheer curtains and a electronic window screen that provided total privacy and darkness. Our son stayed in the Living area which was on the smaller side but had plenty of room for the open sofa bed. The two large Plasma TVs were a welcome addition. The staff was helpful and we had a great time exploring Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was great”
Reviews.Author: rogerthom
Reviews.Content: The location was great, staff were really helpful. They hired me bikes and got me directiond to Part Adventura. All over it was a great hotel. I would have no hetitation in reccomending it to other people.

Reviews.Title: “thin walls”
Reviews.Author: iceman38
Reviews.Content: Booked with lastminute.com.great girl called Anne who helped out.don't be fooled into taking out gothic tour by them as it's useless and you have a guide tour who doesn't give it her best.also not for family. Hotel was excellent in terms of location.pricey restaurant.worst of all-thin walls-heard the toilet flushing,other dubious forms of sounds and even snoring.you have to tell the reception downstairs about the room service changing your bed linen etc. but on the whole, not a bad hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: BeckyWalsh
Reviews.Content: This is my fourth stay at Olivia Plaza. The hotel is ideally located in the very central Plaza de Catalunya and is superbly comfortable and modern. The outside courtyard is the perfect place to enjoy a quiet breakfast or an early evening aperitif. However, a note to the hotel, i thoguth that service has significantly deteriorated from previous stays and needs to be addressed immediately to maintian the exccellent rating. Front of house staff were helpful but unenthusiastic and service staff virtually non-existent. A number of times I had to go inside the hotel to find staff to get service. Other than that, highly recomend this hotel and would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, but three problems!”
Reviews.Author: mishax69
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from Barcelona and we stayed at the Olivia Plaza Hotel. Overall it was great. A modern, clean and inviting hotel set around the old city of Barcelona. We had a couple of concerns however, and if this were to change, it would make the hotel's quality increase. One - no pool. Two - expensive breakfast. Three - not enough soap. Hotels around the world have pools, and lots of people spend time there. I noticed that in Barcelona not many hotels actually had them. So if Olivia Plaza were to build one, it would be eye-popping, unique and would attract more guests. Breakfast no doubt is delicious and the buffet is wonderful, but 20 euros per person is expensive. Down the street it is 10 euros and also very good and packed with people. Even though the maid cleans the rooms everyday, she is stingy with soap. I had a group of 3 in my room and we finish a bar of soap only for showering. And by the time you find the maid, you end up buying your own in the store. Those are the three things that concerned us most. Other than that, we had a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: sweetiepie19
Reviews.Content: the hotel had reserved the 10th floor for us being that it was an anniversary trip, the views were wonderful, would come home at night and watch the people outdoors till we were ready for bed. there is an electric blind that cuts out all light from the large window, the noise was medium level on some nights and quiet on others, mini bar in room was always full, prices were average. loved the shower and yes the bathroom layout is awkward but was comfy with hubby that we didnt care. the bed was really comfy. barcelona was our last stop on this vacation and i must say best sleep i received. only down side every day a different sheet had a hole in it. but everything in the room was clean, and staff always replenished our vanity set. tv is all in spanish we only watched cnn because it was the only english channel. there is free internet service which was great for hubby and work. overall the staff was wonderful, spoke perfect english and very accomodating, highly recommend the hotel for service, cleaniness, and location. it was one block from las ramblas, next to the metro, starbucks, subway, hard rock cafe, tourist locations. best part of our whole trip. feel safe to book olivia plaza i am not posting photos because the ones already posted truly represent the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: ottawadt
Reviews.Content: My friend and i stayed at the Olivia Plaza for 7 nights in July 2008. Pros: great location (trust me- it cant be beat!), cool design (modern, boutique style), free internet, bright and clean, quiet and comfortable, safe, and the majority of the staff were fun and friendly. we had a room at the back of the hotel with a really beautiful view of an old church... views of the city from the 10th floor were very pretty too. Cons: one evening the cleaners left our room door open (forgot to pull it shut), one of the front desk staff was quite cold when we were looking for restaurant suggestions, then again the next day when asking about nightlife, the restaurant "nineteen" served macdonalds french fries as part of my three-course table d'hote (23 euros total)- it was both shocking and funny at the same time- skip the restaurant! Would recommend the hotel, just dont waste your money at the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - would recommend”
Reviews.Author: rhaines
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel in a brilliant location - airport bus and tourist bus are right outside. Great central location for exploring the city. We had a 10th floor room with a view over the square and a view to the sea from outside our room. Rooms are modern with a funky twist. English and American news channels on the TV along with the spanish channels. All the staff were friendly and helpful I'd definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at Olivia Plaza”
Reviews.Author: starHongKong
Reviews.Content: I am glad that I have chosen Olivia Plaza while I stayed in Barcelona. Modern decoration, friendly staff, convenient location..... worthwhile to stay. The only thing that I am not satisfy is the 'water' but I am not sure whether it is the problem in the whole Barcelona or only this hotel. Tap water was too salty which made me feel uncomfortable after shower.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location and bed!”
Reviews.Author: LittleLud
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the olivia plaza in mid-july for four nights, the room definately made our stay because on some days when we got a bit lost and tired in barcelona coming back to the hotel room meant we were happy again. If we had been staying somewhere that was not as brilliant i am sure we would have been a bit annoyed at ourselves. Like everything in Barcelona the hotel is stylish and has some quirky features like the lights and bright red walls! everything works and there is no need to ask for anything as it has already been done for you. The bed was very very comfy and because you have a blackout blind on the window you could just end up sleeping all day! the location is the best bit. Because of it we did not have to buy bus or metro tickets, we walked everywhere. The square seems busy and noisy when you get there but you can hear nothing of that in the rooms which is really nice, the air con is also a plus! the safe is very up to date and you set your own code so there is no chance of things going missing and the shower is brilliant! all in all i would definately go back again. The only problem we found in barcelona is finding a good place to eat, the food is sold high and not good quality on places like la rambla and the main streets, we found some good places near the sea and in placa reil (just of la rambla)...be prepared to queue for food in les quinze nits but it is worth getting a good quality meal and 1/2 litre of sangria for just 3.50Euro's!! Barcelona is a wonderful city, with loads to see, taste and places to relax and get a good tan in! the olivia plaza made the city an even better stay (and having an ice cream shop next door helped too!)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, SUPER location”
Reviews.Author: Gitano
Reviews.Content: The best possible location. Steps away from Las Ramblas and the subway. We had a room away from the Plaza and it was super quiet. One problem was with the AC which did not seem to cool that well but one thing I learned was you have to keep the curtain closed in the summer or lots of radiant heat gets in. They have a GREAT breakfast buffet but way too expensive for me (20 Euros). We got food from the nearby Corte Ingles dept. store - a very nice place. The staff was pretty nice. It was expensive but that is pretty much standard for the high season in Barcelona. We were 3 people and it seemed harder to find rooms for 3.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: kawc
Reviews.Content: Great centrally located hotel. Airport bus leaves off right in front of hotel. We had a front-facing room and no problem with noise. Clean comfortable rooms with ensuite minibar. Modern amenities. We enjoyed the terrace bar for drinks. No concierge if you are looking for this type of service, but the front desk staff was very helpful throughout our stay. We would highly recommend and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fraudulent charges on my credit card”
Reviews.Author: haiyan
Reviews.Content: We booked our holiday package to Barcelona through lastminute.com and the hotel was great... until I got my credit card bill this month. Our whole trip was prepaid through lastminute.com. When we checked in to the Hotel Olivia they took my credit card for any room service charges and said nothing would be charged to it. We even paid for our room service by cash when we left. So a month later I get my credit card statement and there is a $447 (!!) charge from Hotel Olivia. No warnings, no calls, no letters. Now I'm worried who else has my credit card details from that little transaction!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: mifi_ni
Reviews.Content: Booked the Olivia Plaza and we we were not disappointed. We had a room with a view overlooking Catalyna Plaza. The hotel was centrally located and the staff were extremely helpful. All in all a great place to stay and we will definitely recommend it to family and friends. G & M N Ireland

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION AND GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: ShahzTravel
Reviews.Content: During the early part of June 2008, I went with my husband and kids to Barcelona, and stayed at the Olivia Plaza hotel. All I can say was it was absolutely worth every penny. We were a minute away from the famous La Ramblas, across the street from the open air tour bus which we used for sightseeing, next to the Hard Rock Cafe (don't go..service was horrible) and a ice cream/dessert shop, near a Burger King, McDonalds, Starbucks, etc. We had access to great shopping both sides of the hotel, 20 minutes walk to the Barceloneta Beach, Acquarium, etc, great restaurants near, the fresh food market, and a grocery store on La Rambla where I purchased juices, and snacks for my sons. El Corte Ingles department store also has a grocery store in the basement that serves sandwiches, etc. We packed a picnic and headed to the beach. The staff spoke excellent English and was pretty helpful, although we didn't really need much from them. Right before we registered, there was an irrate traveller who had issues with her nightly rate being increased without her knowing it. The hotel room was comfortable, although we had an issue with the A/C for the first 2 days, but the weather was pretty cool during the week we were there, so it wasn't too much of a problem. The only negative was that the hotel room walls are pretty thin, so be aware. Also, don't eat in their restaurant, because I saw a hotel worker drop food off of a platter near the service elevator and put it right back onto the platter and went to serve it. But the hotel is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “So soooo....”
Reviews.Author: Emilyturca
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is new and nice..The thing is that I was in Barcelona for business and had to sleep early and get up early..The front rooms with the Plaza Catalunya view is very noisy till very late hours,that is why I had to change my room and the breakfast was not "100% ready" when I was there at 7 am even if it says "the breakfast starts at 7 am",I had to wait for the plates to arrive etc..Its location is perfect both for shopping and sightseeing activities..

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel with a great restaurant”
Reviews.Author: 060611b
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Olivia Plaza hotel for 3 nights and was very happy with my choice. First, the location is ideal, the central plaza of Barcelona. The bus from and to the airport stops practically at the doorsteps, and the tourist office is across the street. The lovely boulevard, Rambla, starts at around the corner. The hotel is very new and very stylish, can really bear a name of a Style hotel...The style being functional minimalism.... from the rooms facing the plaza a beautiful view can be had over the the heart of Barcelona. The restaurant of the hotel, named 19, must be one of the best-kept secrets in Barcelona. Not only serves it dinner earlier then the usual 8 P..M, , I had mine at around 6 P.M, but with a very good 3-courses menu, glass of wine included, for about 20 euros,it presents a really good value... It has a lovely courtyard terrace...

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a find”
Reviews.Author: bachChicago
Reviews.Content: What a great modern hotel in the heart of Barcelona. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful in giving us directions to different sites. The bedroom was very comfortable, and very clean. We were worried about noise and only had a problem one night, the room next door had the radio turned up very loud. the rest of our stay we didn't hear a thing. The bathroom is cool with the glass sliding door between the toilet and shower. The ammenities in the room were good. We would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lori52
Reviews.Content: I decided to book Olivia Plaza after reading reviews on TripAdvisor. It is in a great location in the middle of all the action but very quiet. We stayed there 3 nights before our cruise. I had told them that it was our anniversary and they upgraded our room and left us a bottle of champagne. Nice touch! Room was very clean, great bed and pillows and we loved the view of the street, just wished there had been a balcony. Bathroom was a little strange, shower would flood floor if you weren’t careful but no big deal. Breakfast was ok not great but included (make sure you book your room with breakfast included it is not worth what they charge you if you hadn't prepaid) and served in a pretty room or patio. Staff was very nice and helpful. Big department store on the corner across the street, which was a great place to buy wine etc. before boarding our ship. Overall a great find and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: TEDELA
Reviews.Content: Great location, friendly staff, restaurant and lobby area rather limited Spacious rooms make up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: Aathony
Reviews.Content: Above average hotel. Stayed for one night only prior to a cruise. Incredibly convenient if flying into the main airport. Hop on the regular airport bus & within 30 minutes you arrive at the Plaza de Catalunya, right in the centre of the city. The single fare was about 4 euros. The hotel is on this square, about 100 meters from the bus stop. Check in was very fast, the receptionist being exceptionally friendly, & we were given a map of the city. Our room was on the 6th floor, overlooking the main square, with great views. This is a modern hotel, I think about 2 years old. Our room was spotlessly clean, with lots of storage space, plenty of the usual toiletries, separate shower & wc, & an extremely comfortable bed. It was furnished in a very modern style. It also had a flat screen tv with lots of choice, efficient air conditioning & in room safe. The blinds were electronically controlled ! Would happily have stayed here on a longer break. Made the most of our short time in the city. No more than 2 minutes away is Las Ramblas. Also, if you turn right outside of the hotel, then right again, this takes you into the Gothic quarter. I noticed the city tour buses also departed from the airport bus stop. Coming back into the hotel late that night, there was a security guard on the main door. We had a very peaceful night. Couldnt hear a thing from outside or within. Bed was very comfy. Didnt eat in the hotel, but had a light breakfast & superb coffee at Cafe Zurich, also on the square. We were given an hours extension to our check out time, so we could explore a bit more. For those needing to get to the cruise terminal, I would suggest a taxi. Took about 15 minutes & cost 25 euros with luggage. Plenty of taxis in the square. Next time in in Barcelona, we would definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: dbchase
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel. Well located near Las Ramblas and the airport bus. Staff was very helpful and friendly. Our room was quite large. Hotel is less than 2 years old and is finished in modern style. The back terrace is a great place for a drink.

Reviews.Title: “Serenity at the Olivia”
Reviews.Author: ciaraDonegal
Reviews.Content: After readin the tripadvisor reviews we booked Olivia and weren't disappointed. Ask for a higher floor as it does get noisy in the Plaza Catalunya at night. There are usually live acts on the pavements outside and the sound does carry. Rooms are tidy and the shower we had was top class. Quirky room layout. We would advise not eating in the hotel in the evenings as the service is forgetful and slooooow, they even forgot to come back to take our dessert order and then proceeded to charge us for another table but we werent too bothered as we were soo chilled, Barcelona had that effect on us! Breakfast is underwhelming but adequate I guess, not really what you would expect for 4 star. All in all a good stay in a fabulous city with lots to explore. Try cake shop called Caelum and a funky restaurant caled Nonelle, really good. You should also go to the restauant on the 4th floor of the History of Catalunya Museum at the marina, yummy food and fab views. Metro is really easy to use and take the airport bus, 2o mins and you are 2 min walk from the Hotel, just 7euro for the return trip. Oh yeah have your brekkie on the terrace, glass floor and funky architecture.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and cool design”
Reviews.Author: nofrillstravel
Reviews.Content: Great location. Cool design. Very friendly staff. Overall I would recommend this hotel for a weekend away in Barcelona or for a business trip

Reviews.Title: “brilliant hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: ray087
Reviews.Content: We went for our anniversary and went shopping came back and to our suprise ther was a bottle of champagne at the end of our bed. How nice was that? Absolutely lovely hotel, just couldnt fault it top class. We were so well looked after and it is absolutely spotless. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for more!!”
Reviews.Author: Happytraveller070
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a suberb location with the stop for the airbus almost right outside and the journey from the airport taking only about 20 minutes. The staff were all very helpful and friendly and the rooms were amazing - furnished to the highest spec. and spotlessly clean. The main stop for the tour bus, again, is only about a 2 minute walk from the hotel entrance. - This hotel is perfect for the Barcelona first timer as everything is on your doorstep and as it couldn't be more central it makes it extremely easy to navigate around the city. The lobby and bar area are very slick and modern - all in all it's the best hotel I've ever stayed in and will definately be coming back for years to come!

Reviews.Title: “Great Short Break”
Reviews.Author: RJT04
Reviews.Content: Hotel location was absolutely spot on with everything in easy walking distance. All hotel staff were friendly, helpful and polite and nothing was too much trouble for them. The hotel was an eclectic mix of a modern style laced with 'old' Barcelona with its surprisingly discrete terrace providing a quiet escape from the busy street outside the front door. Our room overlooking the back of the hotel gave a long distance sea view and a roof top extravaganza and although the front of the hotel overlooked the busy 'Plaza de Catalonya' we had no noise spilling over whatsoever. All in all an ejoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: VancouverBarb
Reviews.Content: Location is great. It is situation right on Catalunya Square in the heart of Barcelona. This is where the tour buses for Monserrat etc depart from. The rooms are clean and nice. Staff is friendly and helpful and speak English. Restaurant food (esp. dinner) is fabulous. We had a flood in our room, the shower upstairs leaked into our bathroom. Front desk staff moved us immediately to a beautiful suite. They handled the situation very well. Only complaint is that the rooms facing towards the inner courtyard can be very noisey. Although we were on the sixth floor we could hear conversations in the dining/bar area until 2 am. Then at 5:30 am the hotel restaurant staff started their shifts and were very noisey.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel bang in the middle of the plaza catalunya - can't beat location”
Reviews.Author: maltesegirl
Reviews.Content: Great Modern Hotel - Very cool decor and great modern bathroom - very nice !! had a room on the top floor with a massive window overlooking the plaza - will definetly return .. thank you

Reviews.Title: “Really impressed with Olivia Plaza”
Reviews.Author: LisaLeTouze
Reviews.Content: The Olivia Plaza hotel is in an excellent location on Plaza Cataluyna (just off La Rambla) and the rooms are very quiet, clean, spacious and we loved the black out blinds! We took a twin bedded room and the beds are very comfortable and the shower is really good. Staff are very helpful. Overall would recommend to anyone and we would stay there again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and city”
Reviews.Author: traveler1975flanders
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. It couldn't be in a better place. At the start of the touristic Rambla, but also at the beginning of a great shopping street (Pg de Gracia). The subway and busses are just outside the hotel and also the old Gotic citycenter is just around the corner. The room was beautifull, with a great view on the Placa de Catalunia. The modern design of the hotel and the room was a joy for the eye. The breakfast was the best i've had in years in a hotel. And dinner was simple but good. A perfect location for a trip to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Good Quality Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TinaandColin
Reviews.Content: My wife, 11 year old and myself spent 3 nights at The Olivia Plaza in March in a 'triple' room. This is without doubt a good quality (and yes strangely, but attractively modern) hotel right in the centre of Barcelona...at a reasonable price for its location in comparison with the rest of the Cities 'offer'. Whilst we had read loads of reviews about noise from adjoining rooms and 'open' wetroom showers and toilets, neither of these was an issue in any way whatsoever. We had a 6th Floor room overlooking the old church (as opposed to Catalunya Square) and didn't hear anything day or night! Room quality and cleanliness was excellent and the staff very efficient and helpful. Where the hotel is located is a real benefit...straight off the Aerobus and 50 yards to the front door. If we were ever to go back to Barcelona (which is unlikely - it was OK but "been there done that")... would very likely stay at the Olivia Plaza again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good holiday”
Reviews.Author: ses123
Reviews.Content: We (myself, husband and 3 year old daughter) have just spent a 4 day / 3 night break at the Olivia Plaza. It was immediately apparent that the hotel is in an excellent central location, close to the shops, bars, tourist attractions and metro links. The staff were courteous and helpful. On the first day we arrived before check in, but they helped us with our bags and recommended an excellent restaurant for lunch whilst our room was prepared. Our room had a fantastic comfy double bed and a pull down sofa bed where our daughter slept successfully! The views were also magnificient - we were on the 8th floor at the back of the hotel and faced the catherdral, cityscape and the sea. The hotel has a very modern sleek look, however the toilet and shower may not be for everyone with its glass partions. Also it is quite a smallish hotel and the common areas / foyers whilst beautiful do not really encourage you to linger. An exception is the glass terrace but we did not really get to appreciate that in March. Breakfast was excellent. Very fresh and lots of choice. It was also open from 7am - 11 am which caters for early birds and late sleepers. Overall we had a really good holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, well located and clean”
Reviews.Author: casave14
Reviews.Content: We booked Hotel Olivia Plaza through Internet and after checking several small hotels in Barcelona, we liked the idea that it was a new hotel, small and had a very good location. We had a very good first impression with the lobby an the reception staff, they were very kind, but as soon as we entered our room we heard a baby crying next door, it was like he was in our room, so I called downstairs and asked for a change witch was done immediately and very kindly, they changed us to floor 10 with a wonderful view of Barcelona and Plaza Cataluña and no noise at all. We had a very good experience at the hotel and we could return there any time. The room was spacious, beautiful and very clean. By the way, I always check tripadvisor opinions before choosing any hotel, I find them very helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: yucelten_2000
Reviews.Content: My wife and I along with our one year old son stayed at Olivia Plaza during Easter holidays and we loved the hotel. Excellent location. Very modern hotel and the rooms are very clean and spacious. We were assigned a room looking to the inner section of the hotel. The room was fine except we prefered a room looking at Catalunya Square. Just 10 minutes after we were moved to a room with a terrace on the 9th floor for the same price. Wow !! great view. Amneties in the room were first class and they are sound proof for sure because we did not hear our neighbours or outside traffic. Only thing I can suggest for the Management is to put a tea/coffee maker in the rooms. We found the staff extremly helpful and friendly especially to our baby boy. Restaurant is nice with a limited but good food. Breakfast was very good with good choice and it lasted until 11.00 o'clock. I can recommend the hotel without hisitation even to families with young children.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: avinalaugh
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights as a surprise for my partners birthday had excellent time. Upgraded free to superior room when they found out it was for a birthday and had a fanatastic basket of fruit delivered to the room. Unlike other reviews could not hear a thing from any of the other rooms. Very good bed and deep bath ideal for aching limbs after a days sight seeing. The room was cleaned every morning and new stocks of soaps etc. Also very useful was the aircon which I didn't think we'd need in March but it was quite hot. Great terrace bar for a drink before hitting the town. Very central literally 2 mins walk from where you get dropped by the airport bus (7 euros for a return ticket). Also just across the road from where the Bus Turistic starts. Loads of lovely places to eat and drink just walk down the Ramblas(again 1 min from hotel) and take one of the little lanes leading off and you're in another world. The staff on reception very extremely helpful and on our last day looked after or suitcase until later in the day when we were leaving. Am definately looking forward to returning to Hotel Olivia Plaza. Many thanks for looking after us.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel in center of barcelona”
Reviews.Author: elHamstero
Reviews.Content: positive: good location stylish hotel (open bathroom, shower was a sensation) breakfast richfull but expensive friendly staff negative: minibar was counted automatically without use of it windows cannot be open, just air condition

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Weekend Break”
Reviews.Author: Nathalie-Essex
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to Barcelona for a long weekend and booked the Olivia Plaza. Amazing location, the hotel is close to everything and right in the main square. We were on the 7th floor and we heard no sound. The tour bus has 2 stops just outside the hotel. The rooms were modern, funky and clean and the staff were really friendly. I would definitely recommend. *****

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - very clean hotel - great staff- good food”
Reviews.Author: TARPON8
Reviews.Content: first time in Barcelona and the web page looked good for this hotel, you just get the feeling as soon as you enter that you made the right choice. The room was a good size with all modern facilities, staff were very helpfull and the breakfast was top quality. The location is terrific 200yds from the airport bus drop off and 200yds from the top of the Rambles - could not be better - strongly recommend this venue John & Hil

Reviews.Title: “Excellent locaation BUT rooms are definaately sound-proof”
Reviews.Author: r4reilly
Reviews.Content: Prime location, right in the heart of Barcelona, airport shuttle bus stop practically outside hotel. What a pity that the rooms were so noisey - we were very lucky not to have had noisey neighbours, because we could hear ever every single sound they made.... conversations, phone calls, coughs .... The staff, rooms and location are great. but why have they advertised sound-proofed rooms, they are anything but- beware

Reviews.Title: “suprise break”
Reviews.Author: RobtWales
Reviews.Content: We would thouroughly recomend the hotel to others visiting BARCELONA. A great hotel, excellent facilities, very friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Lou1111
Reviews.Content: What an amazing hotel! The staff were helpful and friendly. The rooms were so clean and funky! I would definately stay again

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MoneypennyMunich
Reviews.Content: We can highly recommend the Olivia Plaza, the location is fantastic. We had read previous reviews and decided on the A1 shuttle bus from the airport instead of a taxi, perfect. There was a problem with our reservation as our booking agents had failed to book our rooms, as it was my 40th birthday celebration this could have been a disaster, but the problem was dealt with very professionally and we were given rooms even before our agents had confirmed our reservation. The hotel was extremely clean, we had a room at the front of the hotel and although it was a busy street there was very little road noise in the room. The breakfast was very good, normal buffet, help yourself, there was plenty of fresh sliced fruit which was really nice. All in all a very pleasant stay, and we would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Molly452
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 3 night stay at the Olivia Plaza and we could not have been more pleased! Everything about it was excellent, from the sparkling, modern rooms to the gracious, helpful (and English-speaking) staff. The location was the best in the city, right on the Plaza Catalunya. The airport bus dropped you right at the door and all the sights were just a stroll away. I would highly recommend this gem of a hotel!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: jabacivic
Reviews.Content: geat hotel great location 100%

Reviews.Title: “A very good stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: LeMaineMenot
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly stituated. It is the place to be, to start and to end. Rooms are perfect and well cleaned and equipped. Help desk is friendly and the have free internet!!!!! Breakfast is Excellent. Tips: Take Oropax with you, their is a lot of traffic noice if you have a street sited room. Txapela is a Tapas restaurant you must do. Just 5 minutes away and the reception know's where it is!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Contemporary Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RyanMarin
Reviews.Content: Olivia Plaza is a very nice contemporary hotel with a wonderful location right on Placa Catalunya. Steps to the Metro and La Rambla and Eixemple district. We were given a "premium" room because our room was not ready until 3pm when promised at 1pm after we arrived weary from US travel at 830am. The 2nd floor room was very nice and featured a king bed, very nice bathroom, and impressive view of Placa Catalunya. Only complaint was a 530am wake from a very large assembled crowd outside the hotel for some reason.

Reviews.Title: “Best Located Hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: LondGirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed on Olivia Plaza Hotel for 5 nights at the end of January and we were very pleased with this Hotel. We booked with Travelocity who had the best deal at the time. On arrival we were immediately upgraded to a superior room with a fantastic view of Catalunya Plaza which was a nice surprise. The room itself was spacious, contemporary and very unique. I found no problem with the glass panelling that seperates the bathroom from the bedroom as the glass is so thick you cannot see through it. On arrival at Barcelona Airport do get the Aerobus which stops just outside the Airport to the left, it's about 4 euros and so easy, about four stops to Catalunya Plaza and takes around 25 mins depending on traffic. The best thing about the Hotel is its location, it cannot be beaton and you'd never get lost. All the tourist buses, Aerobus, taxes, Las Ramblas and Gothic Quarter all on your doorstep! This was our first visit to Barcelona and while I personally wouldn't rate it the best european city, the people were very friendly and the food and wines were to die for. We were recommended some very nice restaurants by Alex on reception and being seafood lovers we were not dissappointed. One of our favourite restaurants was Taller de Tapas in the Gothic Quarter with an open kitchen and everything cooked fresh. Las Ramblas is quite safe, just be careful with your belongings, loads of street entertainment especially at the weekend and a small market on a Saturday. For good coffee and drinks head to Cafe Zurich opposite the Hotel, this place was always our final stop before heading back to the Hotel. We found the staff on reception very polite and extremely helpful and english was spoken very well. Rebecca always with a smile on her face. All in all a nice break with a perfectly located Hotel in the centre of Barcelona, what more could we have asked for!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location at Olivia Plaza”
Reviews.Author: windspouse
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right on the Placa de Catalunya. The rooms are fairly large with a minimilist bend. The restaurant and outdoor patio are quite lovely, and the food is better than average. The staff were wonderful, and very attentive.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Valle08
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff, great breakfast, perfect location, nice rooms, not enough storageroom from cloth.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Karl1980
Reviews.Content: Booked via Ryanair hotels and saved quite a bit. The hotel is located just off Las Ramblas, and is adjacent to Place de la Catalunya, where the touristic buses start and stop. Hotel was very modern, clean and staff very helpful. The room was very comptempory with an interesting arrangement for the toilet and shower, side by side, closed off from the rest of the room by a single frosted glass door on runners, accompanied by a mirror opposite. The room also appeared to lack sound insulation, we could hear next door using their electric blind and TV, but other than that it wasn't an issue as out most of the time. The location was perfect for getting around, close to metro stop as well. Lots of shops near by and a short walk to the towns gothic quarter. For those that can't help but visit the American themed restuarants, the Hard Rock Cafe is a couple of building away, on the same side. Ideal location to set out and view Barcelona, reasonable price for a 4* hotel

Reviews.Title: “Olivia Plaza Hotel, Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: SpongebobSqPants
Reviews.Content: The hotel stay was very pleasant and cosy. It's location was excellent. The room was relatively clean. The staff were very friendly and helpful. I had some problems with my luggage - it did not arrive with me in Barcelona. However, when the airline fnally delivered my bag, the staff had it promptly delivered to my room. We did however have one minor complains - the first day we arrived, there was a terrible stench that emitted from the bathroom. It smelt very much like the sewer. We reported it to the Front Desk, and they were quick to fix the problem.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay at the Olivia Plaza”
Reviews.Author: AltoDaBarra
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very centrally-located and offers most of the services required from a 4* hotel at a decent price. Personnel is nice and friendly. A few problems in the room (TV head control missing, lamp blown, etc.) were promptly solved in minutes after the claim was presented. Street noise was inaudible but my room was not overlooking the street. Room was large and modern with electrict curtain. Breakfast is trivial, and invoiced separately. The hotel performed my expectations, and I expect to be a guest again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BozzHertfordshire
Reviews.Content: Great central location, good first impressions, staff very courteous, our room was clean and modern with good facilities, only negatives were the fact that our room was not sound proofed as stated and we could actually hear next doors conversations, also couldn't get a hot drink/cup of coffee after 12.30am no bar or room service available. Breakfast was expensive.

Reviews.Title: “A pure gem.”
Reviews.Author: stephenmc03
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, great location. Yes its not cheap, but you get exactly what you pay for. Excellent service, real iniviting ambiance, great food, and pleasant and engaging hotel staff. I thoroughly recommend this hotel for your trip to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: shanique
Reviews.Content: My two teenage daughters and I stayed at the Olivia Plaza Hotel in January, 2008 and I cannot recommend it highly enough. It is a very modern hotel, with all the latest conveniences..including free internet use for all guests. The room was a good size.. even for three people, the bathroom is worth a specific mention, and the staff couldn't do enough for us. Everything we asked was handled quickly and with a smile, and we were always greeted as we came and went. The location is ideal, being on the Placa Catalunya, between the Ramblas and the Passieg de Gracia. I would have no hesitation in staying there again and would recommend the hotel to anyone visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, trendy rooms.”
Reviews.Author: ladybrockett
Reviews.Content: The Olivia Plaza is in a great location - the very centre of Barcelona. We were given a room on the 4th floor which overlooked the square. The room was very cool and trendy, lots of glass and chrome aswell as a red wall complete with flat screen tv and lime coloured cushions on the bed. The whole hotel is decorated to a very high standard and it felt very 'Austin Powers' completed by the shag pile rugs in the dining room! Breakfast was simple but plentiful with usual cereals, toast, cakes, fruit and also scrambled eggs, sausages and bacon. Breakfast was served from 7am - 11am. Hotel staff were very helpful and friendly at all times and they stored our luggage for us on the last day. Taxi rank and tour buses stop immediately outside and various restaurants, shops, bars etc are all within a few minutes walk. Las Ramblas was just around the corner. It was an ideal place to stay and probably one of the best hotels I have stayed in for a city break - I would thoroughly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Olivia Plaza--the highlight of my trip.”
Reviews.Author: missfivestartraveler
Reviews.Content: My sister and I decided to stay at this four-star hotel after literally hours of research online for the best hotel for our needs. I was immediately captivated by the photos posted by fellow travelers and on the hotel website of the rooms and lounging areas and knew right away that Olivia Plaza was the one. Though the rooms are a bit pricey compared to American hotels, nothing else compared to the chic, modern design of the rooms and lobby. Upon arrival, I was greeted by two fluent English-speaking workers who immediately took my luggage and gave me their full attention. My sister had not arrived yet, as we came from different destinations, but they let me check in at nine a.m. anyway though the hotel was nearly completely booked it being new years. The rooms looked exactly the way they did in the photos, and I was intrigued by the unique open design of the bathroom. It made the room look much more spacious and luxurious. The outdoor terrace downstairs is amazing and has a glass floor and heaters—a perfect place to relax in the night. The Internet room is also elegant—with two computers with free Internet. Plus, the location is nearly perfect--right at the beginning of La Rambla, near the Barri Gotic and within easy walking distance of Paseo de Gracia, an upscale shopping district. Overall, the highlight of my stay in Barcelona was Olivia Plaza. I admit, at times I just wanted to lie in the comfortable bed and watch tv instead of going out. Moreover, on our fourth night we were upgraded for no extra charge to a larger room with a great central view of Catalunya Plaza. I love this hotel and the staff I became friendly with. My sister and I were greeted by constant smiles and greetings whenever we walked by the lobby. If I ever come to Barcelona again, this is the place I’ll be staying.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: LexieNewcastle
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Airport bus drops you off 25 yards from hotel - 7 euros return.Only 2 minutes away from Ramblas area. Room very modern & clean - ideal for short term break.Highly recommended Only disappointment was breakfast. Eggs cold, no toast and quite expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: champs_7
Reviews.Content: A late review, but I have just booked to go back in June and wanted to leave my comments! Really lovely hotel, brill location and really really good staff. We travelling to Barcelona for my boyfriend's 21st birthday in May and I had called ahead to arrange for us to have a nice room and also if they could help with arranging for some balloons to be put in our room for when we arrived. I expected a few balloons, when we arrived there were around 10 hellium 21st balloons dotted around the room - fab. Hotel staff were very helpful. Rooms sound proof, very pretty bar courtyard. Always very clean. Overall a brill stay and will now stay every time we travel to barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “I really enjoyed the Olivia Plaza”
Reviews.Author: acalzadilla
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights including new year's eve. This is a very well located hotel, just in front of Plaza Cataluña. The rooms are very comfortable and the service at breakfast is very good. This is the second time that I stay at this hotel and I definitely will stay there the next time I visit Barcelona. We booked for the new year's eve dinner at the hotel, but we think it was not so good according with the price we paid. Apart from this the Olivia Plaza is our first choice when we visit Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: robyn265
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Olivia Plaza Hotel in Plaza Catalunya , Barcelona over the Christmas period in 2007. Our experience of this hotel is very good. The cleanliness of the room was exceptional, with new towels provided every day. We loved the room layout, although I would recommend it for couples rather than friends as the toilet/shower arrangements leave little privacy!!! The staff were very friendly and helpful, we had to change rooms as our toilet started leaking on our third day. This was organised very quickly. We also had to print our return flight tickets, there was free internet access and although no printer was available, the reception staff were more than willing to help out. Breakfast was included in the price we paid for our stay and it was superb. Fresh fruit, cold and hot dishes, breads, cheeses and preservatives plenty to choose from and of a very high standard. The only negative aspect I would mention is the price of the Christmas and Boxing Days' dinner menus. On the 24th december the price quoted was 18 euros for dinner, on the next 2 days the price increased to a whopping 68 euros even though it included alcholic drinks we still felt that an increase of such proportion was extreme!! On the whole, we would highly recommend staying at this hotel, the staff and location is superb.

Reviews.Title: “Best place in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: msharon
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveler mainly for business. This time I was in vacation for few days with my wife and kids and it was a great surprise to be in Olivia hotel. New, big rooms, very modern, clean, excellent service, always ready to help, Prices are very reasonable and I just hope they will not increase them :-). The hotel is just few meters from the La Rambla, actually in Plazza Catalunya, which is the center of Barcelona. We really enjoyed allot, and for sure I will book this hotel in my next trip to Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “A pleasent stay”
Reviews.Author: shiri34
Reviews.Content: olivia hotel is the perfect place to stay in brc. the location is the best, in the plaza catalunia near la rambla, so you can walk and take the metro. the room was comfotable, very clean, modern and quiet. also the stuff was lovley and gave fast and helpfull service. i hope to come again & recommend to my friends. thank you, shiri, israel

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Bigal370
Reviews.Content: Overall an excellent stay, staff friendly and pleasant, location absolutely spot on for attractions and transport. The hotel was very clean and modern, can't say the sliding glass frosted doors to the toilet and shower were my style but this is a tast e thing only and a very minor point. Only had a short stay so did not try the hotel food. I would definitely stay at the Olivia Plaza again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in Beautiful Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Him-and-me
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, modern, contemporary, clean, staff professional and friendly, breakfast great. This hotel ticked all the right boxes! A bonus as well was that our beautiful room was on the eighth floor at the back of the hotel, with marvellous views of the city below us and the sea beyond. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Janis”
Reviews.Author: Davidovics
Reviews.Content: Our weekend in hotel was very pleased and nice. Evrything was O.K.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: dlpcanada
Reviews.Content: I had a nice room - very modern, same as picture and facing the opposite of the plaza... so it was nice and quiet with a picturesque view. Everything was great, staff, cleanliness, amenities etc. Location of course is likely the best in Barcelona and I got a good online deal. I would likely stay here again when returning to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: ToonBarmy
Reviews.Content: As I'd stayed here before we were upgraded to a superior room on check-in. Much bigger than the standard rooms with a bath as well as shower and a view over the plaza. Breakfast was excellent, no problem with noise and super friendly staff. Nothing to complain about at all. Location is ideal as just about everything is within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “a clean and modern design”
Reviews.Author: Didi33
Reviews.Content: At first we were surprised it was no smoking and the television channel numbers were not that much for that hotels categorie. we never saw such an amazing bath room with that special shower and toilet combinaison and the staf team was very kindfull. very good experience ! R&D

Reviews.Title: “Love barcelona love my wife love the hotel”
Reviews.Author: montyMidlands
Reviews.Content: Great stay. We are fussy(my wife really) but this hotel gave us nothing to worry about. If you want a fashionable hotel this is it. Would recommend it to couples (couples with kids go somewhere else) Taxi driver did not know it though. Get the bus instead very easy. The hotel staff first class. t was really central and a great base. Excellent wet room shower. Breakfast good but so many good place to eat anyway. The coffee shop next door was good, go upstairs to watch the world go by in comfort . .

Reviews.Title: “Not good!”
Reviews.Author: MikeCP
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on 2 occasions recently and were not impressed! The place looks good and has an excellent location. Upon check in and check out the staff were curteous and helpfull. They also helped us with our travel plans. Positives end there!! When we got to our room, which was nicely decorated, we found there were no toileteries!! Not even a bar of soap!! We aksed for some while were heading out, took a bit of explaining but we thought that would be it. Got back to hotel to find some bath gel left for us..still no soap! On our first night I awoke early to the most intense foul smell I have experienced in a long time...almost made me sick!!! Very srong hydrogen sulphide smell...We got up fairly early and left for the day...we brought a spanish speaking friend back to the hotel who also requested soap and we finally got some!!!...As we were only staying till the following morning and the smell had dissapeared so we stayed put. When we checked out and mentioned the smell we were told it "was nothing to do with them". Also on the first night the bar closed at 12!!!! (Barcelona???) and we could't get a drink to bring to our room as "the till switches off at 12"!!! We returned 4 nights later and all was relativley ok. (Toileteries included!!) Another observation is that the air conditioning vent in the bathroom is not connected to anything...you can see the void space between the floors!! Overall not impressed and will not be back....

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ny10019
Reviews.Content: I must say that as a frequent business traveler and someone who stays in hotels more than 250 nights per year, my experience at the Olivia Plaza was incredibly disappointing. As I mentioned, I am constantly on the road for business reasons, however this past August while on business travel in Europe, I decided to stay an additional week in Barcelona as a vacation. I came across the Olivia Plaza website and thought that this hotel was exactly my style with the clean and modern finishings. It was more expensive than other hotels I looked at but I was willing to pay the extra money since I loved the design. When I got to my room my initial impression is that it looked great. But then I looking around I noticed that their were all sorts of deficiencies with the quality of work. The bathroom enclosure was entirely made of glass (a detail which I thought was nice). However when opening the sliding glass door, you needed to use both hands and force it open. Then within the bathroom there was a 2nd set of doors for the shower and commode. When opening these doors, the glass door was so poorly hinged that it made a really loud noise and sounded like the glass could shatter. The glass bathroom walls that met up with the sheetrock were not finished properly and you could see all the raw materials behind it. I could go on and on. I was amazed that a hotel developer could allow such a poor quality of work, but it didn't initially bother me so much since I didn't own it. That was until my girlfriend got stuck in the bathroom and we literally had to force the door open. The sliding door was completely de-hinged and would no longer move. We went to the reception and notified them of this. They sent someone up to fix it. This fix lasted until the next day when the same thing happened. Once again I went to the reception and complained. They advised me that nobody was onsite that could fix this until the next day. She then told me that I should be able to fix it myself and it shouldn't be that difficult. When I told her that she could give it a try if she wished, she just gave me a dirty look. She then said asked if we could live with it for a couple of days. Since we could barely squeeze into the bathroom I told her this wasn't an option. She then said she only had two rooms available. One was a downgrade on a lower floor (causing me to lose my view). The other was an upgrade which she said would have cost an additional 60 Euros/day. I have been in many hotels and have never in my life been asked to pay for an upgrade due to a deficient room. I tried to explain to her that it was unfair for me to be downgraded since it was not my fault and that she should give me something as good or better. Unfortunately there was no convincing her and I was forced to take the other room. This room had similar issues, however at least the door opened. On my last night in Barcelona I was having dinner at a restaurant when I noticed that someone had stolen my bag (which contained my wallet and all my credit cards). I immediately found a phone and canceled my cards. The next morning I went to the front desk and told them what had happened. I received no sympathy from any of the hotel staff. The response I received from the lady at the reception was "Well you could have waited a day before canceling your cards". I was amazed. She then told me that she would not let me leave the hotel without payment. Was she going to keep me hostage? Fortunately I was able to convince the manager to trust me to wire him the funds (which of course I did immediately when I got home). I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. Although I still think that the designer did a great job planning the space, I'm sure he is not very happy with the end results. However this is something I could have looked past if the hotel staff was friendlier.

Reviews.Title: “Love Gaudi City”
Reviews.Author: Ropje
Reviews.Content: It was the second time I visited the hotel and I must say it is a pleasure to be there. Right in the middle of everything, complete luxury and nice staff. There are only two things I would like to mention that surprised me a bit: - we had a room with two single beds - we did not ask for it and preferred a double. We did not ask for a roomchange, so I don't know if that could have solved the problem easily. - we did not receive new soap and shampoo. Not necessary every day, but after the second day it would have been nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at superb location”
Reviews.Author: Nirn
Reviews.Content: This is an ultra-modern hotel located in an unbeatable location- on Plaza Cataluña, 1 minute walk from the airport bus final station, the Bus Turistic stations and from the top of the La Rambla street. The back of the hotel is an old church- the north side of the old city. The rooms are large and clean, and even the rooms overlooking the busy Plaza Cataluña are quite at night due to a good insulating windows. The rooms are not intended for two complete strangers: The shower door is a sliding glass door serving also the toilet, and it is quite transparent, so no real privacy can be achieved. Breakfast is European standard but expansive (17 Euros + Tax). There are many alternatives in the nearby streets. The only complain I have is the lack of any sports facilities (gym, pool etc) in the hotel, unlike many of its 4-star hotels competitors.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ChilternSkipper
Reviews.Content: Very good location at top of Rambalas-cool terrace-staff a little tardy -fridge broken on arrival in suite-apart from that couldn't fault

Reviews.Title: “I want to go back....”
Reviews.Author: m19dut
Reviews.Content: After an appalling experience at a 5* all inclusive resort in Turkey, I was very apprehensive about this trip. Upon arrival this apprehension was very short lived. Walking through the automatic door out of the heat into a beautiful, air-conditioned reception, I knew my girlfriend (named Olivia!!) and I had made the right decision. The décor was immediately pleasing on the eye. The hotel staff were always smiling and on hand to help wherever they could. The location of this hotel is amazing. It is less than 100 meters from The Ramblas and within walking distance of most things. Rooms with a balcony are exceptional – although there are only 5!
