All rooms are very clean and housekeeping is excellent. Sitting outside on the hotel bar terrace, was amazing. It was hard to believe that only meters away were the busy streets of Barcelona! On the negative side, the rooms are not soundproofed, as we discovered at 2:30 on our first night. One phone call to reception and within 5 minutes, someone was there to move our bags to an upgraded room on the 9th floor. This is the sort of attitude so many hotels lack these days – Excellent customer service. To sum up, I can’t wait to visit Barcelona again, and this is where I will be staying. The hotel is very trendy and funky and suited my girlfriend and me perfectly. The hotel is well worth its 4*s.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in the super location in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: nadrikusha
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent. The design is very interesting and nice. Staff are friendly (especially, there was a person called Markus, who was extremely helpful!). The only thing I did not like was that the bathroom and basin in the room were not well cleaned... at least that was my impression. And the other thing was that the windows do not open, which I generally do not like. Overall, I am very happy with my choice, it was great to stay at the heart of Barcelona, and I will definitely recommend Olivia Plaza to all! Thank you. Maia

Reviews.Title: “great city Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rawaspecial
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 5 women staying in the Olivia Plaza for a long weekend and loved it! The location is great (Aerobus stop, Metro stop, right in the city center...) and the rate we paid was ok as it is advertised (and deserves to be) a 4 star- we could have got something less expensive of course, but you usually pay for what you get, especially in a big city. The hotel decor is a bit weird at first - but it really is something different and grows on you. We were given one double room for two people and the other half of our party was given a family room or even small suite (?) as it had a huge sofabed as well as a bath and separate shower. Unfortunately the previous guests had smoked in the double room, even though the hotel is a non smoking facility. So we complained at the front desk and received a different room immediately. We did not have any problems with 'privacy' either in the bathroom or shower as some reviews had mentioned! We did hear guests next door talking & laughing very late one night but we also got home late the next night - Barcelona is a city that never sleeps! Other than that no noise problems. The breakfast buffet was very nice; fresh fruit, juice, cereal, eggs etc. and everything was always quickly replenished. We never had to use the Metro or public bus; only went on the tourist doubledecker which was great! Would not recommend eating on Las Ramblas or Placa Real as very expensive and not good food. Actually we had a few difficulties finding nice & inexpensive restaurants - one time we were even refused service because we did not order 'enough' food for 5 people! Can only recommend the basque restaurant Txapella a few streets from the hotel (recommended by front desk). Great Tapas! If I would visit Barcelona again I would definetly stay at the Olivia Plaza once more.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel And location”
Reviews.Author: mlpjames
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Spain, and the Olivia Plaza was a wonderful first experience! Beautiful, clean, contemporary retreat from the bustling city for my husband and I. Our room overlooked the Playa de Catalunya, which I would recommend requesting. We were steps from Las Ramblas and wonderful shopping and restaurants. I totally recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel : Modern with excellent location”
Reviews.Author: edm71056
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Olivia Plaza 18th to 21st August 2007. The location on Catalunya Square is perfect for touring the city ( Bus Touristic, Metro Lines and Airport Bus all at this location). 2 minutes walk to Las Ramblas, 5 minutes walk to the Gothic Quarter make the hotel perfect for exploring all that Barcelona has to offer. The hotel is modern in design and its rooms are of good size, with a unique bathroom design that we really liked. The room was clean and in good condition. We stayed in Room 607 overlooking the square, no noise problems from the square or other guests. The fantastic floor to ceiling window gave stunning views over the square. Breakfast was excellent with a good high quality choice of food. The Terrace bar at the rear of the hotel is an oasis of tranquility after the noise and bustle of the city (we reccomend the Pina Coladas!!). Staff were freindly and helpful. No hesitation in reccommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: pfpollack
Reviews.Content: I had stayed here on business twice before and chose it again for vacation. It is actually better suited for the latter than the former, though they did make a valiant effort to accomodate the demands of a high-powered business meeting (multiple high speed connections, Faxes, phones, rooms, etc) The location cannot be beat- right on Plaza Catalunya with easy access to buses, tour buses, trains and walking distance to many attractions. The staff is very friendly and accomodating and their English is certainly better than my Spanish! The hotel is well appointed, modern and comfortable, though they give out round balls of soap that are a bit awkward. That's about as bad as it gets. Overall a very positive experience and relatively reasonable considering the location, which really cut down on the cab fares.

Reviews.Title: “Weird Hotel But Great Location”
Reviews.Author: nicensleazy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic location and is perfect for first timers like us to Barcelona. The hotel is modern and the reception and lifts and common areas make you feel that you are in a sophisticated hotel. The rooms though are a bit weird. Its like someone had a vision of how the rooms should look and went out and bought lots of nice fittings and then gave them to some cowboy builder to put them all together. The location of the flat screen TV was located so you couldnt see it properly from either the sofa or the bed. The bathroom fittings were impractical with the sliding glass door having a handle on the outside of the shower but not the inside - why? - you had to put your palms flat on the glass to move it. Also although the glass was patterned you could through it and see the person in the shower from both the bathroom area and the main room itself. Also the walls are paper thin and we could hear the neighbours banging away at six in the morning !!

Reviews.Title: “Superb!!”
Reviews.Author: jodyDublinIreland
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Olivia Plaza hotel for 5days at the end of July 2007 and i could not say enough about how terrific our stay was. If you like ultra modern, chic and minimalistic then this is the hotel for you. It has a superb location and one literally steps off the plane onto a bus and is dropped directly across the road. All staff are courteous and friendly and could honestly not do enough for us. Due to a maintenance problem we were upgraded to room 906 (penthouse- own terrace, jacuzzi and complimentary champers) We were delighted. They put on a great spread for breakfast that caters for everyones taste...and the margarita's in the evening are to die for. As they say..location location location....We will be staying here again....

Reviews.Title: “Great Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LONDONMANIA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Olivia Plaza hotel for two nights. Olivia Plaza is a very modern contemporary hotel, everything was nice and new, I am glad we chose this hotel instead of taking a chance with an older traditional tired hotel as you would expect to find in a busy city. I must say that we were impressed by the entrance, presentation and swift check in. The hotel reminded me very much of the Threadneedles Hotel in the City of London - the decor was extreemly similar - very smart. Most importantly the rooms were spotless and comfortable. The room was minimalistic. I think that the sliding door to the shower and toilet were a nice feature, as was the sliding wall. Afterall, it's a hotel and it's good to be able to enjoy an unusual novelty for a few days. The shower was lovely! The location was excellent. Everything (bars, restaurants, Las Rambla entertainment, shops, main bus stops, including the tourist and airport bus were "just there"). We did not eat at the hotel as there were so many other places nearby. We stayed on the fourth floor. The lifts were swift. There was slight street noise at times, but nothing disturbing, plus we didn't have any trouble with noise from guests in the next rooms either. The staff were extreemly polite and helpful at all times. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JackBauerHampshire
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two days in the Olivia Plaza at the end of May 2007. The hotel has the best postiton, right near to the bus stop from the airport. Very central, we stopped back at the hotel each day, to drop off bags and refuel before heading off to other parts of the city. We were on the 8th floor with a view of Plaza Catalunya. The room was fantastic, we had a shower and a bath. A huge bed and a seating area. We liked the open feel of the room. We did not opt for breakfast but went to the cafe Zurich, just across. Barcelona is a fabulous city, the market in Las Ramblas is great, Placia Reial( just off from Las Ramblas) amazing for drinks,tapas and people watching. La Sagrada family is worth a visit, we got a taxi and then walked back. Fab place and a great hotel. We will be back and have recommended to many of our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like a bull in a ring!!”
Reviews.Author: FrogDogNy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in worse hotels in my life but this is the worst "expensive" hotel I have ever been to. The pictures don't look so terrible but what they don't show is that the rooms have scary red shiny walls lit up by overly bright lights. I couldn't relax in the room at all, and when I was forced to be inside the room I turned off almost all of the lights because the red wall was so unnerving. And they didn't even have a radio or anything to play music. Thankfully I was only on business and didn't have free time to spend in the room but I would have been terribly disappointed if it were my holiday destination. The materials used to construct the rooms were really cheap and you could hear absolutely everything that went on in the other rooms, even your neighbors flushing the toilet! I hope they are not planning to make this a chain....

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kirkygirl
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a fantastic hotel. We had a brilliant stay here. I booked the Olivia Plaza after having to cancel another hotel we had booked in Barcelona and I think we definately came up better off. The hotel is sleek, stylish, contemporarily designed and an oasis of calm in the middle of not only a busy city, but probably the busiest square in Barcelona! From the moment we arrived we were treated like important guests and the staff reall couldn't do enough to help us and ensure we had a good stay. Our room was lovely and clean, overlooking the back side of the hotel (I recommend booking a rear sided room) we over looked the amazing glass floored terrace and the medieval church built for the knights templar set behind the hotel. Our porter brought our bags up for us and showed us exactly how everything in the room worked, so there was no guess work needed on our part! Quite simply the hotel is wonderful, really fantastic location right in Catalunya square and if you stay there make sure you enjoy at least one pre-dinner drink on the beautiful terrace before heading out to sample Barcelonas night life. ( the food at the hotel is pretty good too although the breakfast is a bit pricey) The free internet access is also a huge bonus! The only negative thing I would say is that unless you like very firm matresses, you may find the beds quite hard, as I did......oh and only stay at this hotel if you really know and are comfortable with the person you're staying with as there isn't a great deal of privacy in the bathroom facilities :) But really don't let that stop you from experiencing this wonderful hotel. I would stay there again without hesitation........in fact I don't think I would stay anywhere else in Barcelona!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: rogtravel
Reviews.Content: As everyone says this is a wonderful central location and the rooms are very modern and functional. (We did have a bit of a problem with water running under the shower door if it was on for too long.) We had a room on a lower floor (we had asked for an upper floor but the hotel was full due to conventions) and really weren't bothered by street noise. The breakfasts were excellent and we ate there two times since they seemed a great value despite the high price.

Reviews.Title: “Hummmmm!!”
Reviews.Author: ARW5
Reviews.Content: I've just come back from the Plaza after having stayed in Barcelona for 2 days. I like the overall look of the hotel and its fun features, but most of the reviews are correct.....it is very noisy and you really must know and love the person who you stay with as there is no privacy with the bathroom setup. There is no turn down serivce which you would expect in a 4* hotel but the beds are fab! Beware of the metro as my husband had his wallet stollen after having been in the city for about an hour. The hotel staff and the police were very helpful.
